description: Nice funky bar that helps keep San Francisco weird. Friendly bartenders, good stiff drinks, good beer selection and that nostalgic feel.
author: John B.

description: They purposefully block a ton of music on the jukebox. Categories not available are hip-hop, house, EDM. Basically anything a lot of people in SF might want.
author: Jorge G.

description:
Bums special:Hamms & shot of Evan Williams:$6.00!!!
When I have out of town friends visiting, always take them here. When I'm alone, I come here, and there's always friendly regulars to talk to.
Best part: many dogs, and their people don't get upset when you pet them!
author: Douglas A.

description: Ok Space but Bartenders are a pretty sad group of Douche Bags.
author: John A.

description: I fucking love this dive bar. Any dive bar, really, but this one in particular has  cheap, strong drinks, good bartenders,  loud music to my liking, PINBALL (always extra points in my book), and is generally devoid of "bros" of any kind (Marina or otherwise). When all the other dives in town are dying and making way for bougie "lounges" (rest in peace, Kimo's) serving $14 cocktails and people who will buy them because they don't know any better, I'm glad i can count on good ol' Molotov's to just be a straight up good place to have a bullshit-free Friday night and a strong drink. One of the first places i went to as soon as i turned 21, still drinking here at almost 33 years old and I'm thrilled it's still around. Please never close!!!!
author: Theresa C.

description: Bloody Mary Review - No matter what my purpose is for visiting San Francisco, I always manage to find myself enjoying a round of pool, strange conversation, and red wine spiked bloody mary at Molotov's. Why? (1) Any respectable drunken bar crawl will enevitably take you past Molotov's, (2) I can't pass up a good deal and (3) it's got hella good dive bar vibes. Why go? Red wine spiked bloodys. | Price: $5
author: Shelley B.

description: Great dive bar, cheap drinks and there's always dogs inside!!!! What more could you want? There's pin ball machines inside and once I was here when a tamales lady came in! Tamales are definitely a game changer when you're drunk. Watch out cause this place is cash only. Well drinks will run you about $3-$5 and beers are anywhere from $3-$7
author: Kulmeher D.

description: Didn't check out the yelp page til we walked in. It was busy so we decided just to check it out. But, Never again! The vibe was off and the place was really old and dirty. There was a dog seating at the bar on his own barstool. Hahaha. This must be a dog friendly there was at least 5 medium to large size dogs just chillin inside.
author: Ron V.

description:
Epic people watching here. Came in while our tattoo artist across the street at Idle Hand drew up our stuff. Bartender was friendly and both of our drinks were $5 for happy hour. 

They had a pool table and pinball machines inside. Minus one star for a funky old beer smell
author: Micah R.

description: Great dive bar where we will enjoy fond memories for a long time to come. We had fun guessing the playing card written on the under side of the PBR bottle caps, and for those into craft beer, they offer a great selection. Thanks for a fun time, bartender Stephanie!
author: Steph D.

description:
Everyone complaining about the staff has zero sense of humor, no comprehension of a real dive bar, and seems to be very sheltered. "A scary-looking crowd"?? If you consider dogs and a bearded local old man playing chess by himself scary. 

I come to this bar BECAUSE of the staff. If you stop acting like an entitled infant, you'd find they are all genuine people and interesting to talk to. Anyone complaining about them has clearly never worked a service job and probably never tips- Are you expecting a personal, motherly cheerleader when you order a drink from a local dive bar, from bartenders with decades of experience, who have seen hundreds of people in all states of inebriation come and go? Do you need freshly imported orchid flowers and a bartender who thinks he's a chemist and performs fancy tricks for you? Then go somewhere in the FiDi or Marina. Even better, Vegas. This is a dive bar.


If you want pretentious, fake staff that sucks up to everyone (guess what- they're only being "nice" to get a bigger tip from you. as much as you want to feel special), if you want your hand to be held, if you misunderstand a remark and instead of talking it out with the staff, you post a passive aggressive whiny yelp review, go to touristy bars and sterile lounges in SF. There are PLENTY. 

I've frequented this bar for years because it DOESN'T feel like a manufactured zoo with mute bartenders numbly serving person #57 of the night like a factory line until their shift finally ends, complete with perfectly placed dime-a-dozen modern "fancy" or "nice" interior design. That is NOT a dive bar.

I've come here with friends but this is also a  great dive you can come to alone and unwind, maybe pet a dog. Nobody is frontin and tryin to act cool and secretly judge one another. Everyone is here relaxing from a hard work day with alcohol, a pool table, and classic tunes. 

In the real world, not everyone will act like your mommy or daddy. Don't expect a local dive bar to be a daycare center. Don't immediately be shocked and outraged because a bartender isn't politically correct. 

Also this bar is not racist.. As a minority I can confirm after years of patronage vs. the one guy who came here once... who happens to be white. 

Overall, Molotov's is an authentic, refreshingly unpretentious, truly local dive bar- complete with unpretentious prices. Sometimes, sheltered people wander in and expect it to be a fancy Vegas lounge located in The Wynn Encore. 

Ideally, Yelp should be a place one can find intelligent, well-rounded reviews and not a place to snitch because your feelings were hurt- leading to an emotionally biased review.

Leave Molotov's alone. How can anyone think a bar that has CUTE DOGS as REGULARS is offensive and scummy? The dogs are relaxed... and you should be too.
author: Hunter H.

description: What's that? Beer for ~$2? YES. I'm in. Love that this place has a great juke box, good vibes, and a bunch of friendly regulars -- including the cute four-legged kind that jump up to sit on the bar stools. It's great for mid-week drinks after work and, I'm sure, pretty lively on the weekends. (I've not yet tried it outside Monday-Thursday.) If you're fussy about getting dog floof on your clothes or old, sticky seats it's probably not for you. If you're into a spot of pinball and affordable drinks, you'll be into it.
author: Rowena H.

description:
Dark and dingy but legit, good peeps and dog friendly.

Best prices on beer in town.
author: Robert M.

description:
This is the lower Haight shit bar. Bartenders have attitudes of di$ks and treat customers badly. This bar deserves a zero rating for shitty bartenders and their scumbag attitudes. Beer is cheap but you can take your business to other places where they don't treat you like crap. 

Overall a shitty bar in San Francisco
author: James X.

description: What can I say about this bar One word Fucken awesome Bro , Awsome bar , Awsome owners , awesome staff , awesome next door neighbors (olooneys)
author: Abe M.

description:
Molotovs doesn't need your Yelp reviews.

And no it's doesn't take Apple Pay.
author: Matt G.

description: Great place, like "everyone is friendly". Just stopped to charge my phone, use the restroom but stayed. Bought some beers, played some pinball  and everyone or close too just wants to chill.exchanging tabs and just wanted to "get away" from the craziness.
author: Michael S.

description: This place was perfect to get a fast bloody marry! Corey with out a doubt made one of the best spicy bloodys I've ever had ! Thanks
author: Darryl B.

description:
Fuck my life (FML), one of the best bars in San Francisco and a regular watering hole of mine. Would've gotten married here, if the wife was cool with it. Where the shit do I start expressing my love? I'll keep it eazy breezy:

The bombs:

- Dope decor. Stickers all over. 
- Nice and dark, so I don't have to see your fugly face.
- Sick music selection, let the locals work their magic. Keep your Taylor Swift at home, techie bros/bras. 
- Friendly bar staff, keepin' it simple. Get a Pabst (guess the cap) and Powers. No flirtinis served here, go see that mixologist down the street. 
- Dog friendly (CHILL DOGS ONLY!!)
- Can bring food inside. No, I'm not talking about eating a fucking 3 course meal. Simple sandwich is fine. 

The facts:

- Cash only
- Pool table
- Pinball
- Close the bottom door after yourself

Here's some suggestions:

- Come early (or anytime on weekdays) you can hang out with the regulars. Be respectful and easy going. 
- Come later (after 8 on weekends) to visit the techie/yuppie zoo. No admission cost!
author: Kenny H.

description:
This bar was righteous.

Great bartender, diverse clientele, and I learned how to play the game 1-4-24

I was extremely pleased to spend a good hour here before moseying on to the next spot. 

If I'm ever back in Lower Haight for the evening I will definitely make a point to grab a pint at this spot.
author: Kipper S.

description:
Terrible bar. Only positive aspects are that its pretty cheap and has decent pinball games and a pool table.

Bad atmosphere, bad crowd, did not satisfy any of my dive bar cravings.
author: Abby Z.

description:
Let's check the list:
Grimy atmosphere
$2 beer
Punk on the jukebox
Pool table
And everyone knows your name. It's like a post-apocalyptic Cheers!
author: Cass C.

description:
This is not a bar pretending to be a dive bar. This is a real dive bar, with a real edge. 
The drinks are stiff and cheap(I recommend the bums choice,$5 well whiskey and a can of hamms) there are dogs roaming about, and the crowd outside blends in effortlessly with the sketchier residents of the neighborhood(who may or may not have an address). 
Oh, and there's pinball. And occasional fights the bouncers will force outside the bar. 
If you're looking for service with a smile, this is not your place(the bartender is often not even behind the bar). 
If you're looking for a truly different experience with a crowd heavily weighted towards SF natives, this is your place. 

Personally? I love it. I love the screw you attitude, I love the prices, and I regularly enjoy the people as well.
author: Michael C.

description: Bad ass dive in the Haight. Had a great time drinking Jameson with the bartender. If you love a sketchy neighborhood spot, this is A1 awesome. Loved the place and was bummed they didn't have shirts.
author: Bobby H.

description:
Good selection of music on the jukebox, $2 PBR... What's not to like?

Chill punk rock dive bar in the lower Haight that doesn't seem to give a shit what you like as long as it's not Google Glass.

On the real though, you're probably gonna get your ass beat if you try any of that tech bro shit here. Just no. Stop. Don't. 

Get your drank on and save the number crunching for work, techwad. Kplzthxbai.
author: Graham H.

description: My kind of bar. No frills, extremely nice people, good atmosphere.. and most of all, DOGS. Dogs everywhere. Furniture was dog-fur-coated like my own. Felt like home even though I was hundreds of miles away.
author: Shaws J.

description: Terrible customer service. Extremely rude staff, one in particular was a bartender with a "P*ssy Slayer" shirt. When I asked for soda since I was driving later, he said "Here you go, ladies." When I didn't finish the drink, he asked, "Did you just order a Coke to not finish it?" What's it to you?
author: Manoj S.

description: Came here for a quick drink before heading to Outsidelands and the bloody mary was fantastic and only $5. Total dive bar and I loved it. Friendly patrons, skilled bartender, dog friendly (water bowl inside) , hilarious stories and would be my regular bar if I lived nearby.
author: Lisa L.

description:
Order of events on a Saturday night:

1. Squeeze into the bar after being asked for IDs
2. Wait behind people who aren't ordering, they're just standing (six-deep) in front of the bar
3. Make my way past and order a pint
4. Drink with friends and scope the crowd
5. Watch a dog saunter in and vomit in the middle of the floor
6. Listen to those around it howl in disgust
7. Count how many people unknowingly step right into said vomit
8. Inform the bartender that there's dog puke, to which a simple shrug is returned
9. Hope no one does the splits into the sick
10. Watch the dog return and begin to lap up its own regurgitation
11. See the doorman come by, throw a paper towel onto the floor, and kick it around the remnants of the now-mostly-gone spew
12. Decide it's time to leave... and probably never return

I like my bars sans dog (or any) barf, thankyouverymuch.
author: Adena B.

description:
This is crazy. My friend KC told me what happened at Molotov's.

Sorry being out of touch for the last month or two. But he let me post my story on his yelp account.

So I walked into a bar recently and took a seat. I got my money out but dropped a few bucks. So I bent down and picked it up. As I did, I looked behind me to make sure no one saw how clumsy I was. And there She was. A lady standing about 12-15 feet behind me peering at me through her Google Glass. The light was on so I knew I was "On the Air." Or at least my backside was. 

So I asked the fair maiden, "Did you get a good shot of my good side?"

She simply giggled like a little 15 year old girl and said "OMG, It was totally Crackalicious."

I said "Crackawho?"

And of course she giggled some more.

So I said, "You know, even though you act like a 15 year old, you look much older or else you would not be in this place." I continued to let her know that she did not have to go through all this trouble in buying Google Glass. All she had to do is buy me a Shot and a PBR. I'm easy.

This time she giggled so hard her Google Glass fell off. She was so embarrassed that she ran out of the bar leaving her expensive phone and purse. So I humbly thought, Wow! My Crackalicious is outstanding!

I didn't catch her name or her number but she looked familiar. Who could it be? So I went home with optimism that maybe, just maybe, if it does go viral, I could land a gig as a butt model. Yeah!

However, I woke up the next morning feeling so violated! How could this have happened! Was I video raped! I mean really, I went to a bar minding my own business and the next thing I know my Crackalicious is out there for the World to see.

So please help. I'm begging. I need some advice.

Should I sue this woman if it does go viral or get a restraining order?

Should I sue Google for not putting the following warning on their product?


WARNING: Google Glass may cause the following:

1. Heart Attacks: Resulting from the excitement recording other people's lives rather than your own poor pathetic life.
2. Memory Loss: OMG, Where did I leave my expensive purse and phone?
3. Perversion: OMG, That guy's so Crackalicious!



If any of these symptoms occur seek help from a Psychiatrist Immediately!
author: KC C.

description:
I walked into this Bar with my video camera rolling. I also had my crew with me who thought it was a real cool idea to start filming bunch of strangers as they were trying to have good time. I really don't get it!!!!
I was a victim of hate crime, like totally!!!
my sufferings that night only equal to those of Jesus when he was nailed to the Cross. Yah, I am a total victim.
author: jamila u.

description:
Lets be honest.  I bareley remember being here.  

I do remember the Sailor Jerry and Coke I had was very, very strong.  I only had one though.  

I remember that it was not that busy in here for a Saturday night.  And I took a bunch a photos.

That's about all I remember.
author: Ivy R.

description: Good selection of beers! We were able to get a table on a Friday night after waiting (and stalking) for 20 minutes. The music gets too loud though, so this isn't a good place to try to catch up with a friend.  We couldn't hear what the other person was saying, and ultimately left in search of a slightly quieter place to get drinks.
author: Jaching H.

description:
Perfection has been improved upon! I would have already given Molotov's 5 stars BEFORE all these douchebags started saying they'll never drink there, except that I was worried that if it was rated too highly a bunch of douchebags might start drinking thre. No worries aymore! Now that it's the only guaranteed douchebag-free bar in SF, there aren't enough stars on Yelp for me to rate it correctly. 

Bless you, Molotov's, for somehow finding a way to become even better.
author: David K.

description:
I went here a little while back with a few friends for a drink as we were looking for more of a low key night.  I hadn't read any reviews about the place nor had I picked this location. 

The place was fairly empty when we arrived.  We didn't have trouble getting drinks in a reasonable amount of time.  The bar tender wasn't exactly rude but wasn't exactly friendly either and made it clear that their friends sitting near the bar were the real priority.

I grew up in a town known for its dive bars but there is a fine line between a dive bar and a place that feels and smells like a dark & dank basement of a frat house that recently had a party.

This place smelled heavily of animal urine & felt very damp & gross.  There were a couple random dogs walking around unattended without leashes on..  Wasn't surprised at that; however, I felt that the place was overall disgusting. 

I'm all for dive bars and the more relaxed and chill crowd they are usually known for, but honestly I would not go back here if someone paid me.
author: Katie W.

description:
Authors of dystopian fiction used to envision worlds where the government (or at least some sort of corporate neo-feudal lords) killed privacy by planting cameras everywhere - TVs, shower heads, vents, outlets, etc. 

I can't think of one that envisioned privacy dying by way of idiot tech hipsters with egos the size of Jupiter strapping stealth recording devices to their own faces voluntarily, because they think they're so Special and Brilliant that it's necessary for them (and that they're entitled) to record everything and anything they see 24 hours a day anywhere they go, even if it's on someone else's property. 

If any author did call this (prior to about a decade or so ago) I'd love to read that book. PM me.

.....

Anyway. Cheap-ish drinks and a mellow vibe when it's not too crowded (and someone isn't intentionally starting shit to get attention)
author: Jeremy H.

description: best dive bar around. dark, even in the daylight,  drinks are good bartenders range from, grumpy,  corky,  too hot! when in the city one of my must stops.
author: Sandy S.

description:
Didn't like it. It was really really grungy. I get that it's a punk bar and all but come on. Have at least some cleaning standards. 
Ick. 
Oh and beware if you do end up going, everyone inside will stare at you for at least 30 minutes. For no reason. 
And don't play something on the jukebox that you like because everyone will stare you down for that too. 
Didn't get a drink because the bartender ignored me :/ 
Doesn't matter. 
Plenty of places to drink elsewhere :) 
An extra star because it's in a good place to shop. 

P.s. Parking suuuuuuuucks!!!!
author: Ariana L.

description:
This is a no bullshit,strong drinks, dive bar.

I had a fine experience here. The drinks are strong and they allow dogs into the bar which is awesome.

I read on Yelp! after the fact that they allow outside food as well.

A lot of people say they love the music, when I went it was punk rock and some other stuff with some horrible sound quality but I guess some people like that.

I would definitely come back especially if I was in the area.
author: Drew P.

description:
I love any place that's got pinball and booze. Molotovs is in a great location that has lots of good food right nearby. 
You may have to fend off some crackies in this hood but that's the lower haight. 
Bring a bowl and a babe .. Have some booze and ball out.
author: Jeremy R.

description:
Best bar in Lower Haight.  $2 PBR, $5 shots.  Prices have never gone up in the 6 years I've been visiting here.  The owners are kind, down to earth people that believe in keeping the character of the bar, instead of turning it into a gentrification cash grab.  Patrons of this bar come from all walks of life and are well-mannered and friendly unless you act like a jerk, which fortunately isn't tolerated here.

All the staff are wonderful.  Dana usually has my drink ready to go BEFORE I even get up to the bar! That still blows my mind sometimes.
author: Bryan L.

description:
Visited for the first time last night and am very glad I did! The atmosphere of the bar was cool--not too crowded, not too empty. The bar service was good, and the drinks were definitely affordable. There isn't much seating available, but I didn't mind standing near the bar and watching Viva La Bam on their TV while enjoying my beer. 

I was especially pleased to see the owner's dog roaming the bar. Who doesn't want to meet a happy dog while they're out on the town? Definite highlight. 

The lower Haight is becoming one of my favorite spots in the city, and I'm glad to add Molotov to my list of bars to visit in the neighborhood.
author: Jen C.

description: The ID checker pushed me because I didn't notice him when I was walking in -- put his hand on my chest and forced me back how about you don't manhandle your customers
author: Aaron H.

description:
The bartender was chill and friendly, and I shook her hand.

Happy hour beers rock.

Had a deep conversation about sexuality with a friend here one time.

Happy hour beers rock.

There are no yuppies here.

These are all good things.
author: Thuan N.

description:
Molotov's is my staple Lower Haight bar.  It became that way largely through its dog-friendly policy.  Your pooch is allowed inside, off-leash, and odds are other patrons or one of the bar staff will have dogs there, too.  It's a reason alone to become a regular here, but there are other perks, too.

The bar staff is extremely friendly, especially so to regular patrons.  They normally select the movies to play on the bar's TVs, and are more than willing to defend their selections if you're so inclined to complain.

Tap and drink selection is good, but not great.  The bar has a number of specials (including the requisite dive bar shot-and-beer for $5), so you'll be able to drink a lot cheaply if that's your aim.

Tunes are good, the patrons are friendly (especially if you bring adorable dogs into the equation!), and they have a number of DJs and sponsored events on the weekends.  Oh, and free barbecue on Sunday afternoons.

What's not to love?
author: Bill H.

description: I'd really like to sh!t on this place but this is my home bar away from home.  Way ahead of the  other bar I referenced in another review. I only really come here when Toronado is packed.
author: Michael D.

description:
Warning: Utterly shallow and prurient review follows.

I did not end up here by accident on Friday. No, no, no, no, NO...I was in pure stalking mode. See, a little birdy had told me that the insanely hot bartender from Lucky 13 is one of the new owners of Molotov's. As soon as I heard that, I made immediate plans to visit.

Sure enough, come 8:30 or so, in walked Mark and out walked my dignity. I instantly regressed 30 years and became a giggling, ogling 15-year-old girl. A drunk, giggling, ogling 15-year-old girl.

Drunk off the generously-poured and quickly-served shots, drunk off the unbelievable handsomeness that is Mark.

*composes self*

Okay, let me make myself useful for a minute: Fast service, pool table, decent ladies room, inclusive vibe, dog friendly, right across the street from Ali Baba's Cave (for post-booze gyros).

P.S. Eye candy too.
author: Valeria R.

description:
My first thought about what to write about this place: It's definitely a dive bar!

This is a smallish bar, with pretty much no lighting, wall posts covered with stickers, a couple TVs, grimy seating, and loud music. It also has strong, cheap drinks, a good happy hour, and is dog friendly.

 I may not be the target customer, in that I'm not male, and I have an aversion to germs. BUT, I liked this place just fine. It's a full bar, which, apparently, is not super common on lower Haight (?). And, any place that allows dogs instantly goes up in my book.
author: Sonia M.

description:
this review is not so much for the bar as I have never drank here...but more or so for the low life scum that visit this place. 

this review is spurned from a recent article about some creatons stealing someone's google glass...
now i am not a fan of seeing them at bars either...but i would take it a upon myself to steal someone's property. like really....go ahead and be mad but do not violate someone else.

so why i have i not drank here? because like i said its full of scummy human beings. I went here once... a little tipsy...not very harmful. went to the bar...the bartender asked for my friends and mine id's...to which i joke...."hahaha already drunk!" and the reason why i have not drank here as is as follows....
out of the corner of my ear i hear a pasty ass stank bitch say "shut up n****r" to me....i proceeded to be pulled out of the bar by my friends in hopes that that stank bitch got to live to see another day. not one employee at this bar could have given a fuck less about that....

not saying everyone here a complete waste of space but.....

fuck this place.
author: Ashley H.

description: I support Molotov's stance on Google Glass.  And I support their Star Wars pinball machine, if it's still there.
author: Mike R.

description:
They have AMEBIX on the jukebox.

'nuff said
author: Colin B.

description: Cheap drinks! Yes. Scary looking crowd. Place smells like chemical cleaning solution. Grabbed a beer and drank it as fast as humanly possible. I didnt wanna get my ass kicked by the hoodlums in there.
author: Anthony B.

description:
A fun place to gather with your old friends during a weekday. I went there with my friends - had an amazing time with my friends. That said, the bulk of my experience was around the good people that I met there and the oddball stuff that happened there.

I found the staff to be largely unresponsive - waiting and yelling finally did the trick. And, please, go across the street to the bathroom. There's a long waiting line for the scary bathroom - and when you do get into the bathroom, your body will prevent you from going to the bathroom as it is so rancid. 

Go here for your friends and the environment - leap over the staff to get what you want. Go to the bathroom, later. :)
author: Jane E.

description:
Wow, I haven't been here in ages!

On my way home from changing a starter on one of my cars four times yesterday afternoon only to put the original back in the end (the new one turned out to be a defect), I was definitely in need of a drink.  Hit Harry's Bar on Fillmore and then for a nice contrast, hit Molotov's, and then Flanahan's.  Not only that, but I took the bus.  Now that's an interesting cross-section of humanity.

The crowd here last night seemed mellower and cooler than usual.  Fun, alcohol-fueled enviroment and everyone was having a good time.  The bartender working last night, Shae, was really great...so nice and so cool.  She was sharp and professional, yet down to earth and made everyone feel welcome.  As always, service makes such a difference.  Hung out for a bit and was really enjoying the vibe, but had to move on to the next place.

Cool dive and nice pool table too.  Definitely the one of the best, if not the best, of the bars in the lower Haight.
author: Roy N.

description:
What a great bar !
Best music, reasonable prices, pool table, and rad bartenders.
Beau the bar tender is LEGEND ! 

Go by and have a drink ! 
It's worth it
author: Austin M.

description: Find the staff rude and the food sub-par. I also would not return because of their recent stand on technology, so not Silicon Valley/ San Francisco.
author: Bobby I.

description:
I don't even remember very well...

All I remember is they were playing "Use Your Illusion II" front to back. That's enough to earn 5 stars!

For some reason the juke-box wasn't working, or someone fed it a million dollars! Everyone was choosing any song they liked. Well, after "Use Your Illusion II."
author: Alexia R.

description:
Yelp wants me to review this place because I apparently checked in here.

I don't remember.

I think this is the bar where this cougar hit on my friend dressed like an elf in lederhosen.  That was pretty hilarious.

The drinks were cheap - but cash only.  Lots of drunk Santas running around the night I was here (though it was still only 6:30 or so) ... but they ran out of a lot of beers so we had to move on.
author: Kathleen W.

description:
1) dark and kinda dingy atmosphere
2) no prissy music
3) $5 bloody marys on sundays
4) DOGS!!
5) you can bring in your own food.

i. like. you.

a lot.
author: Karena Q.

description: Great place! Cash only FYI. Strong drinks and only $4 well drinks during happy hour but you won't need too many! So strong
author: Gianna V.

description: Great prices, metal and punk in the juke box, dogs are allowed inside the bar. I love this place. So many great times here! If you suck at pool, good luck!
author: Michael V.

description: Came here while on a walk down towards Market the other day. We were planning to head directly to our next destination but passed by and decided to stop in for a drink. Walked up to the bar and no one was behind it. Decided to set my stuff down with my friends and head to the restroom. It's locked and you have to get a key from the bartender. As I walked back to my group at the bar, I realized that no one was bartending because they were standing in the corner by the bathroom having a personal conversation. Now I used to be a bartender, so I know that the best part about it (other than tips and free drinks) is hanging out with your friends. But do it behind the bar where you can actually serve customers when they come in. We waited a few more seconds with no help and eventually just walked out. Very disappointing.
author: Lauren D.

description: I used to have a deep aversion to coming here in my 20's. I thought the crowd had way too much to prove or something , and I no longer liked to listen to MDC and the Germs so I stayed away for a long long long time unless guns were pointed to my head. But then I gave it another shot recently and you know the things that once bugged me didn't anymore. Prices are good , wish it weren't cash only (still a peeve of mine ) , and the crowd is way less prickly.
author: Lauren V.

description:
I used to love getting hammered here and then walking back to my actual rehab up the street.  

Pretty chill spot.  I'll come back for the cheap beers, lax people, and good music.
author: Brad K.

description: This place was cool! This has to be the first bar I have ever been to that had not one, or two but three dogs as patrons! The decor was very cool and the vibe was uber casual. People were clearly there to hang out and weren't planning on breaking away from their conversations anytime soon. It def was a local chill spot. There was zero pretentiousness. I would def come back here!
author: Tammy S.

description:
In college I had  a close friend who refused to wear anything but black (camouflage on occasion) and would always make me listen to Danzig on repeat. Sometimes, he'd leave his black patched clothing in the dryer, and I'd pile them up and bring them to him.

He'd furrow his eyebrows.

Him: "How do you know this stuff is mine?"

I'd shrug. "Uh...I've seen you wear nothing but this stuff for months now, and come on, who else wears all black on this floor? Plus I can still smell last night's beer run on them... Although, I gotta say the white socks did throw me for a little bit..."

He'd grunt and grab the pile from me.

Him: "Uh...yeah....well...I can recognize your laundry too!"

Me:  "oh yeah?!"

Him: "All of your stuff smells like a French prostitute...all that perfume you put on....yuck!"

Me: "whatever...So why do you wear all black?"

Him: "Duh...it's slimming!....Why do you reek of a brothel?"

Me: "To remind you of your MOM!!!! Ooooooo Oh snap!"

He'd shake his head real slow. His friends would bite their lips. 

Him: "Nice try....you're getting there...just work a little bit on the delivery...maybe next time...."

I was constantly trying to come up with some killer line that would blow him away. But it always fell flat. Sometimes miserably so, and I'd be teased for hours afterwards.

Eventually I gave up. Instead of trying to impress him with my sardonic wit, we would stick to things we both could appreciate like Cristina Aguilera and classics like Can't Hardly Wait.

Molotov's reminded me of my old friend:  black clothes, loud punk music, and a hint of attitude. (oversimplified for effect...because of course he was more than just clothes, music, and attitude) You either like it, or you don't.

But...that is its charm. 

And if you get attitude, shrug it off. Don't take it personally.

Molotov's is the kind of place where people chug away their woes. There's music blaring and there's always someone lingering at the bar, just waiting to stir up some trouble. Each time I've passed by there are numerous people stumbling out, swearing as they press their body-weight up against the wall, fumbling in their pockets for loose cigarette cash.

It's not really my scene.

But, I can't deny that they do serve up a good hard drink...(I've had exceptional service here)

...and sometimes that's all you need. 

A hard drink.
author: Jessica T.

description:
After an afternoon of grading papers on my day off, I strolled into this joint to relax before I relaxed some more at home.

Bartender was attentive and very cool. $3 Newcastles? I should camp out here more often when I have the afternoon off.

Yeah, it's a rocker crowd and even though I'm not tatted out, my black shirt helped me to blend in with the locals.

Add some pinball machines - are they really 75 cents a game these days?! - and you got yourself a good time on a chilly mid-February afternoon.
author: Art O.

description: Best Dive Bar in SF! they even embrace the Graff Community!
author: Angelo P.

description: This place is fun with a big group especially outside. I thought it was strange that the patio closes at 10pm (or at least did when I was there) and didn't understand that since tons of people were out there. They did take small dogs but only outside.
author: Lauren C.

description:
Good cheap bar to throw back a couple $2 PBR's or $3 other beers during happy hour.  It seems like most bars on lower haight are pretty dog friendly which is always nice because you don't have to make your best friend wait outside while you drink.

They have a couple TV's usually with football on during the weekends but they don't have the sound on, instead they are playing rock music from various genres but at a good level where it is more than background music but you can still hear people while you talking.
author: Scott G.

description:
This is a dive bar. Perhaps the best jukebox in town, and a wonderful community. Its simple. You either get it or you don't. The staff are fantastic people - you treat them right, they treat you right. It's a world of simplicity and honesty; something I fear the world lacks sometimes.

Don't expect a credit card or bar tab. If you're overly sensitive to: noise, strong smells, furry animals, cheap beer, whiskey, call-it-like-you-see it attitudes, rock, freedom, community, inebriation, crowds, tattoos, body piercings, leather, pool tables, jukeboxes that aren't connected to the Internet? You know what - it might not be for you.

For the rest of us? I highly recommend.
author: Erik Y.

description: I visited Molotov's while in lower Haight & had a great time. Inexpensive drinks, great atmosphere, & really nice bar staff. The jukebox is full of GREAT music - We sat just inside the front door & fed it dollars late into the evening. Really enjoyed this bar! Stop in if you can!
author: Chip P.

description:
Camille K.:
"Molotov is a "Cash Only" hipster bar in the Haight.  They serve very few good beers on tap, along with....Hamm's canned beer.  One can only wonder what hard alcohol they carry.  This was totally not my scene.  One visit to Molotov is enough."

Are you joking?  Please tell me you're kidding.

You're going to enter a bar named "molotovs", a bar blasting 80s hiphop and punk rock, clearly emitting a "punky" atmosphere, then expect that they'll take your credit card at the bar? 

Whats wrong with Hamms anyway?

Stay out of Molotovs, Camille, you can smell your own farts elsewhere.

( Srsly though. Molotovs is the best bar in the Haight. The nicest people, pool, pinball, fantastic jukebox. )
author: Brendan M.

description:
They give generous shots, and I really wish I could like this place.

The problem is every time I come in here (seriously. Every time. It's freaky.) I see crackheads and douchebags. Maybe this isn't fair to Molotov's, because I know you can't really control your clientele. Nevertheless, this place is packed to the brim with crackheads and douchebags, and I feel the need to warn people about this bar.
author: Rachel H.

description:
I only hung out here for a short amount of time.  I accidentally snuck past the guy checking IDs.  Corey lost his ID (and complained about it for a while) he stood outside all dejected.

He managed to get in, because apparently the bouncer said he recognized him and had all ready checked his ID.  They let me bring in pizza from across the street -- yay!

anyways, Corey ended up finding his ID later, inside the cuff of his Santa pants.
author: Van W.

description:
I think almost every venue has a time and a place and this one is a great example of that theory.

Pros: Very eclectic and different. Makes for a great venue for tourists and anybody who seeks to get a gist of the "essence" of the hipster SF scene. Cheaper drinks than normal. There're pinball machines and pool tables.

Cons: One of the most polarizing venue's I've ever been to. You either love it or hate it. Lewd, crewed and tattooed people all over the place. Bathrooms are not clean. Full of graffiti. Difficult to find a parking spot. Too loud to hear yourself think. Located in a not so great neighborhood.

I'd say treat this place as a San Francisco art piece. If somebody's visiting the city, just drop by and have them take some pictures inside and outside this place and get outta there.
author: Jafar Amir Hanovic Ismailov M.

description:
For lack of a better bar choice that wasn't a beer bar, we came here on a Tuesday night to a grab a few drinks.  Prices are decent, but drinks were definitely a bit forgettable.  Rum and Coke tasted pretty much only of watered down rum.  Drinks my friends had all tasted a bit tamped down as well (too much watery ice).  Irish car bomb is hard to mess up, but I'll give them brownie points for topping the shot glass off with whiskey.  Besides, it all goes down so fast there isn't much point thinking too much about it.

They got a few TVs there and a pool table, but you wouldn't mistake the place for a sports bar by a long shot.  Also, always nice to have a guy try to barge into the bathroom while you're in there and ask why you guys can't share the toilet (there is also a urinal in the men's).
author: Lincoln L.

description:
Molotov's my favorite bar in Lower Haight.

Expect cheap beer, pinball, and good tunes.
author: Murphy O.

description: Typical lower haight bar.  Have yourself a nice Budweiser and listen to some heavy metal man!
author: Charles C.

description:
Did a little daytime 4th of July action here. 

....bought a round of beers ( PBR, Blue Moon, Lagunitas IPA) $8 ?? Great prices! 

.....saw the sign outside  that read : FREE BBQ!....Hot Dogs, Cheeseburgers, with all the fixings....FREE. 

watched the Giants lose in extra innings to the Brewers.... I battled the king of the Pool Hall. 

The bartender was a cool mellow punk looking dude ( reminded me of a member of ' The Explosion' 

The crowd was diverse, punks, yuppies, preppy women, dude who looked like Andy Dick, foreign women. 

I'm definitely into it.
author: Taj A.

description:
Moving from Minneapolis, MN I was skeptical if I could even find an inexpensive bar around San Francisco. Everyone seems to be charging a few bucks extra just for a shot of whiskey or a PBR! 
A friend of mine took me here a few nights ago and I instantly fell in love with it. I love the stripped down sort of "late night punk" look it has. The lady bartender was great; she was as a bartender should be: nice and knowledgeable. 
Also, they have two pinball machines!!! I LOVE PINBALL!
We spent about two hours there drinking and people watching, and I had a great time there.

Bring quarters for the pinball, cash for the bar, and a little bit of attitude to your table (in a good way!)

I'll definitely be back for more.
author: Angie P.

description: came here with a good friend for the first time a couple of months ago, and at first i thought this was a cool 'punk rock' bar. they had some good jams on the jukebox,tattooed bartender etc. however the last two-times I've gone there, the service was subpar(taking up to almost 15-min. for a refil) and I couldn't help feeling repulsed at the bartender ladies comments about skinheads being "so hot". neither could I ignore the misogynistic comments coming from the middle-aged cowboy hat-sporting red-neck who acts as if he runs the place... & to top it off there was no music this time and the selfproclaimed punk rock bar, instead, had some lame tv-movie playing, complete with sound. I won't be going back! there're plently of actually cool(punk or not) dives in the city that know how to treat their customers better... :)
author: Brian C.

description:
Felt like I was at just another bar in the Mission. Not a compliment. 

But if you're into it, the majority of the crowd was of the punk variety; skateboard optional.

Whether or not there was actually any vodka in my vodka & cranberry is debatable.
author: Katie S.

description:
Usually I can tell I'm coming up on Molotovs on a Friday night when I see a large group of smokers blocking a side walk.  Once you make it through the death cloud of smoke you find yourself in a cool dive bar with good punk music.

One of the highlights of the Lower Haight area for sure.  Good place to meet up after a long week to have drink to start the weekend.
author: Mitch M.

description:
Its pretty loud here, the drinks are alright.

It's pretty cheap, and I came here on a friend's birthday.  I wish they had more than one pool table, but it's alright!
author: Spenser C.

description:
It's a neat dive bar with a great atmosphere and some extremely friendly regulars.  Music, pool table, drinks, and even a few friendly dogs, this ia neat place to hang out for a bit and relax.

Music can get a bit loud so if you're looking to have conversations, you'll have to yell a bit to be heard.
author: Cassandra J.

description:
I wish Yelp would change on how to rate/score.
I want to put 2 bec the bartender made me two crap drinks that got me really sick on Superbowl Sunday. I had one and my friend couldn't even drink his. At half time, my head was spinning and I couldn't focus on the tv screen. I had to go outside and puke on the sidewalk. I've never in my entire life gotten sick after only ONE drink so the tequila used must have been the shittiest tequila on the market. 
Besides the actual drinks, I love the clientele, atmosphere, energy and overall feel of the place.
author: Emmanuella A.

description:
Why can't there be more bars like this in the Lower Haight?  
I always feel like Goldilocks when I'm trying to find a place to get my drink on in this neighborhood; Goldilocks and the Three Bars. Everywhere else is too boring or doesn't serve hard alcohol, but Maltovs is just right.
author: Marie S.

description:
OK, so I really like Molotov's.

I don't know if it's because it was the last bar we hit up on our circuit for the night or what, but it was a fun place and I had a great time.

It's a comfortable dive bar with pinball machines, a jukebox, a pool table and cool bartenders. One of the bartenders even went so far as to lip "I'm Sorry" when she witnessed a friend and I being approached by a creeper. It was nice to know she felt our pain. 

They have a full bar and the drinks are pretty cheap, which is always a plus. Also, there is a lot of seating and many comfy booths to kick back in. Best of all the tamale lady stops in. I knew nothing of this tamale lady but now that I have learned about her I can't wait to sit back at Molotov's and enjoy one of her elusive tamales.

The crowd is also very interesting and quite entertaining. Most of the people there appeared to be in their late twenties and early thirties and if I may add, many were quite attractive.

I definitely dig Molotov's and you will too!
author: Denise S.

description:
05.29.10

Whatsit, I ended up here Saturday?

I don't remember too much, but their restrooms are spacious and clean!
author: Jenny L.

description:
Worst bar experience of my life happened here.

We walked in and it was pretty empty. Ordered a round of drinks. I got a beer but most others got Tanqueray and tonics. Maybe this isn't the type of place where you ask for Tanqueray.

The drinks were horrible. Not strong, not weak, but just plain bad. I am 95% sure that was not Tanqueray.

I walked up to the bar to get some limes for the others so they could salvage their drinks. The bartender rudely grabbed a few and handed them to me, in a fist. Gross.

I asked if she could put them in a shot glass, which she did after some more rudeness.

We wanted to get out of there, but I decided to have one more beer while the others painfully drank their G&Ts. I went to the bar, ordered a beer, and handed the bartender a 20 dollar bill.

She gave me back change for a 10.

This bar isn't just BAD. They are liars and cheaters. The alcohol is fake, and they will TAKE YOUR MONEY.

Lower Haight has plenty of great bars to go to. There is NO reason to ever go to Molotovs.

If you are the owner of Molotov's, you must replace this bartender. She also doesn't ring up drinks on the register, so she's probably stealing from the bar. Unbelievable.
author: Sachin A.

description:
I'm pretty sure this place could give a shit about their yelp ratings, but I'm gunna go ahead and give them 5 stars anyway! 

1. $2 PBRS. YES!
2. The most eclectic crowd city. YES! (we're talking punkrockers with their dogs to girls in forever 21 going out on the town. This place is hilariously eclectic and that's why i love it.)
3. Awesome juke box and/or DJ

I pretty much never leave this place disappointed.
author: Alixandria F.

description:
Pinball, albeit janky. Frodo and Jean Luc wear mustaches.

Star Trek TNG: lazy left flipper and left probe doesn't launch. 
My friend had a "groundhog day" ball 2. It kept letting her play after it drained. But I still kicked her ass!

Lord of the Rings worked ok, except that the game eats quarters. Don't put in more than 1 credit at a time. 

The bartender was very cool, refunded my eaten quarters and vowed to call the pinball rental co. I guess they have them on speed dial. 

Other than that, $3 PBR on tap, an actual CD jukebox with nary a sign of autotunes, sausage across the street - I'm happy, pappy.
author: Blue R.

description:
Don't come in here unless you've had at least 2-5 body parts pierced.
Usually there's a bar dog who's the coolest and most friendly person in the place. Bar staff are just a touch less gruff than Toronado's. 
As a cab driver said "man, it's a slow death in there." An Bodrain come baaaack!!
author: Ed R.

description: As far as not being a place to take your mom when she's visiting...depends on the mom I guess. I'm a mom and have been there several times with my kids, (all adults) - had a great time every time. Met some really awesome people who are regulars. I don't think the fact that one of my kids works there sways my opinion. I liked the place even before he worked there.
author: Betty B.

description: This place is so filthy (boozevomiturinewindex smelling) that when I have to pee I just run home, grab a snack, and then come back down. That being said, I come here a lot because the drinks are strong, the people are weird, everyone looks better in dim lighting, and I like dogs.
author: Lauren S.

description:
A 3 to 4 star would be in order had I not discovered within a week that this place charges on a sliding scale depending on your look.  Does a person need to bring a W-2 to get an honest price around here?  

My first visit: I got two martinis for $10 (well gin; no hassle).  One week later: I ordered two martinis (well gin).  This time I get sized up (the up-down look), and then get charged $12.  Same bartender, same day of the week, same time of night.  Like a polite person, I tipped him anyways. Stupid! Why do I forget that tips are to reward good service?  The only difference was probably what I was wearing.  Last week - jeans, black coat, minimal makeup.  Tonight - red lipstick and trench. Could I have possibly cleaned up better than last time? After I let the situation stew for a minute, I realized I could have called him out right then or called him out later that night.  Or be passive aggressive and do it on yelp.  I obviously chose the latter.  The former, I admit, would have been ideal.

It's too bad this $2 incident has bittered my opinion of this place because it appeals to my punk rock sensibility (we can save that for a later conversation).  The crowd is laid back; the music isn't so loud that you can't have a conversation; the bar is dog friendly; the drinks are cheap (even when they're tacking on a couple bucks because you look bourgeois).  Plus, my friend thinks it might be her new favorite bar. In spite of all those positive aspects, I gave it two stars ("Meh. I've experienced better.").  It's more important that employees are straight with me. And when I get screwed over some perceived looks tax, my enthusiasm to support the establishment is likely to wane.  It's one thing to give a good price because you're a regular. It's another to charge you based on whether the bartender thinks you can spare that extra $ and not notice.  

Well, I noticed, and I'm not coming back of my own free will.  And if I do, I'm having my more peasant looking friend buy my drink.
author: L K.

description: Like a dog park, with booze! And a great staff. A classic dive.
author: Carrie H.

description:
In college, I spent a lot of time drinking cheap beer and playing good pinball. This place reminds me of those times -- it has cheap beer and 2 decent pinballs and bar staff that have no problem dispensing quarters. And by cheap beer, I mean $4 anchor porter bottles, or PBR that is practically free, and cheap and strong hard liquor. Great jukebox too.

People sometimes bring some pitbulls in here (as in several) and that makes me nervous.. thats the main downside for me.
author: C S.

description:
Had a funny moment when we discovered that not only was the bouncer also from Minneapolis, he was even from within a few blocks from us. The topic quickly turned to the CC Club, a great hipster/dive bar from our shared neighborhood.

"Yeah, this is basically the CC Club of San Francisco," he said.

In my book, that's a hell of a compliment. Can't say I disagreed.
author: Ralph M.

description: This used to be my goto place for true dive bar fun.  A little quiet, but dirty and dank with an interesting crowd.  Not like the dives downtown, no hookers or pimps, just fun.
author: Patrick S.

description: Gritty and a lil smelly but I got a fairly nice bloody mary on a sunny Sunday. Nowhere I'd want to hang out for hours but it's good enough to pop in for a drink. Very affordable!
author: Kiristen R.

description:
The drinks here were awful! I asked for a tanqueray tonic and it tasted like rubbing alcohol.

To top it off, my fiance bought a beer and paid with a $20 and the bartender insisted he paid with a $10 and would not give him the correct change. 

They were rude and make horrible drinks. I'll never go back!
author: Kate A.

description:
some things never change. Remember when the lower haight, in the late 90s, was said to be the "next mission"? well, the mission has remained the mission and the lower haight remains its grungy best.  

here, dogs run free, there's pinball machines, nasty graffiti covered bathrooms, and you can get pleasantly and cheaply plastered amid the 20-something punks.  Neither mad dog or Toronado serve hard liquor, so you'll have to go to Molotov's for your fix.
author: Vanessa H.

description:
So I'm walking back from Golden Gate Park on my way back into downtown.  My girlfriend and I are like 11 hours into out last day in SFO and we've been walking all over, miles on foot.  We decide to head down Haight out of the park and what do we stumble into?  

Walking past Molotov's the first thing I noticed was Monster Bash pinball, a favorite game of mine while in college in Oregon, it's no Mideival Madness, but it's pretty awesome.

It was about 5pm on a weekday and the place was starting to pack up with a happy hour crowd.  Most people in there were somewhat hipster with a bit of a metal vibe thrown in, lots of fixed gear bikes out front and sleeve tattoos inside.  

I walked up to the bar with a clear look like I didn't really fit in and visibly stoked for pinball.  I got a PBR on tap for only $2 on the their happy hour prices, first bonus, the bartender was kind of cute with that "somebody farted" look on her face.  I was immediately summed up by this bartender as not quite cool enough to be in this place, which I probaly wasn't, tourist suitcase on my back, and *gasp* a collared shirt?  I had no tattoos, no ironic moustache, no skinny jeans, no v-neck sweater, how dare I, how dare I indeed?   I did my best to fit in by smoking a Parliament outside and ordering a PBR didn't I?  Her only response to my excitement about pinball was, "yeah, have fun with that".  I can't really blame her I guess.  The table next to ours looked to be full of guys she knew all drinking PBR long neck bottles with practiced looks of subtle ennui.  

All I was looking for was a quick game of pinball with my girlfriend and a cold beer to allow me to stay and play.  I found both at Molotov's and it made me happy.  I definitely felt the vibe that I was too square to be in this place but I didn't really mind.  For a $2 beer and some pinball it is a small price to pay.  I'd say I would go back again and give it another try, but I don't live in SFO.  Oh, and I got one multiball but didn't crack the nut for the replay, oh well, it was worth the visit anyway.
author: Christopher T.

description:
Just your average dive... I am sure there is a small group to whom this place feels like home, I am not among that group's numbers.  Now I should mention that there was nothing that necessarily turned me off from Molotov's, but it was nothing extraordinary either.  Plus, they did not even have a dart board :-|  

The drinks were decent, it was dark as per "dive bar" code - although it didn't smell which I wholly appreciated (and attributed one whole star to this very fact).  At the end of the day (err I mean night) there would need to be a damn compelling reason for me to plan to go here again.
author: Bernadette R.

description: Your going to find some metal, punk and the Wu Tang family on the jukebox. They have a jukebox which is always awesome, pinball and some awesome prices for drinks. You'll find dogs sitting on bar stools and colored mohawks. Great neighborhood place, understandably not for everyone. Not a yuppie bar, your going to see some mohawks. Also, they have a pool table. Perfect size inside
author: J B.

description: Definitely one of the better bars in the neighborhood. Good music, fun people.
author: Patrick S.

description: Where do I start? It's not exactly a craft micro brew sit down joint, nor somewhere you would take mom for a drink when she is visiting. It is in every definition a punk rock dive bar. But we are talking upbeat super nice bartenders. Ridiculously cheap drinks. And prompt quick service. If you go here, tip extra and play some pinball. I come here maybe once every few weeks. Not often but every time I leave thinkin 'love that place'. Expect good music (well if you're into stuff like the Misfits and Murder City Devils), cheap drinks, and fast service. Overall, I should come here more often... ...and the walk from upper Haight isn't as far as it looks.
author: Holmes C.

description: Ok, so this is my first Yelp review, signed up to review some places i visited while on holidays to San Francisco from Ireland. I went to Molotov's twice while on hols & really enjoyed it thoroughly. The place had a really local vibe, but not in a snobby way. It reminded me of my own local at home. The fact that the people seemed to all know each other made it seem all the better, there was a familiar friendly atmosphere. We were treated very well. The pub was clean & smelled nice (to be fair one of the days we were there was 4/20 so the smell of patchouli permeated the air, but i like that). It was clean & nicely laid out. Good bathrooms . Not really sure where people are getting the idea that this place is grimy  or unfriendly. Anyway, the music was good, the staff were nice, the drinks were nice & well priced, & the locals were actually very nice to us. If i lived here i could very much see myself making this place my local
author: Aileen M.

description:
Dive bar.
Pool table.
Dog friendly.
Cheap drinks.
Cool people.
You will get drunk.
author: Jackie G.

description:
Maybe I should get out of the Marina more often. 

Okay, I ordered a draft, pulled a five out of my pocket, then started searching around for my wallet to cover the rest of it. Lo and behold, before I could throw down a few ones, the bartender had already thrown a few back at me. 

Change out of a five? Yep. Enough to cover the tip. Damn.

Minus one star for the pool-players. Yea, you made her keep getting up so you could have a better line of drive...a better line of sight, maybe!
author: Scott W.

description: If i could give a zero to this place i would . If i could walk away from this review i would without even mentioning the name of this place . But i cant so here we go ! I travel all around the world , all across the United States and every time you think you have seen it all your slapped in the face with another story . Lets keep it simple ... i was in San Francisco for the weekend attending my new Grandsons Birthday and was touring the Haight district (which i have done many times before i may add) but this time it was a bit different . I was with my youngest son . I thought it would be cool to show him a part of music history . It was a beautiful day in In the Haight district but rather hot so while walking we came across this (dive) and i don't mean this in a positive way . As i walked by i noticed it was rather quiet , not many people inside so i ask my son if he felt like having a beer and of course he said yes . After walking inside i noticed a sign above the bar which read " Cash Only " not a problem with that so i walked over to the ATM and took out a bit of cash . I stood at the end of the bar with  money in hand waiting for my turn to be asked what i would like to drink . Well that never happened , i waited like 10 minutes . You might think that 10 minutes is not a long time and its actually not when a place is busy . But when a place of business is almost dead dead dead and the bartender looks at your three times but continues to talk to her friends at the end of the bar it is . I don't understand it , i really don't ?
author: Antonio B.

description:
This place is like a big burly dude who is sporting jailhouse tats and leather chaps yet has a small white poodle on a leash.

The poodle makes you think harmless, the tats make you think you are gonna get the American Me treatment.  

Either way, you avoid eye contact and get piss drunk.

It was the Simpsons pinball that made me enter, it was the dark dressed surly crowd that made me keep my shit talking to a minimum.

All in all, good cheap drinks.  

I'll come back when I get my No Fear tattoo on my calf.

You know, so I will fit in more.

Cosmo.
author: Archie R.

description: this place is the definition of a dive bar. I loved it! if you're expecting anything except, this isn't your place. a must stop if you want to feel like a local hipster.
author: Justin S.

description: Friendly attentive staff, not a whole lot of options on tap. Run down hole in the wall. Dogs allowed in the bar, which I find as  a health hazard. .
author: Shakei D.

description: Last time I was here, my boyfriend almost got in a fight with a guy that looked like he had a trust fund and lots of heroin who had permanent dibs on the pin ball machine, and got upset when we went to play it after it had sat unused for 5 minutes.  The drunk bartender then asked us to leave because he was a regular.  Maybe the tune has changed here since then, but it was disappointing when all we wanted was a beer and some pinball.
author: Erin D.

description:
If you like a dark environment, punk music, and cheap drinks this is the place for you.  

Moltov Tip #1:  Watch out for the pool sharks

Moltov Tip #2:  If you see a dog wandering around the bar, don't worry
                           he isn't lost.

Moltov Tip #3:  If you see a dog sitting on a bar stool drinking a  
                           Guiness, you aren't dreaming.  Buy him the next round
author: Josh L.

description:
Anti-hipster bar. Solid juke box of old school rap and 80's punk, with cheesy movies from 80's on the tv's. Great staff, Bo and Simone. Sunday mornings they usually have sliders or hot dogs- goes great with the $2.50 Ham's

Their moto: Leave your attitude inside.
author: Brandon D.

description:
I think the redeeming quality of this "dive" bar is it's pinball machines, which I am lightweight addicted to.  Also, expect a lot of random dogs.

They have a variety of decent beers on tap and specials on a Saturday evening.  

My only gripe was that I asked for PBR on tap since it was advertised as "on tap."  When I ordered it, I was offered bottles.  I said "this is not on tap."  I was then very condescendingly offered to get the bottles poured into glasses.  Then while I wanted to change my order, the bottles got popped and I got a nice "you're wasting my time" from the hardly busy bartenderess.
author: Joey S.

description: GREAT bar now that Martin from Lucky 13 owns the joint.  Good beer and booze selection, $2 PBR draft at happy hour if that's your thing, and the crowd is more laid back than it used to be as well.  More neighborhood folks and less people trying a little too hard to be cool.  Kickass jukebox as usual, and great bartenders.  Add to that the fact that it's next door to the best BBQ west of Texas, and I think I'll start hanging out here a lot more, especially now that my old neighborhood bar, the Page, is starting to get too crowded with kids who don't know how to act in a bar.
author: Joshua W.

description:
Damn you Molotov's  and your punker-than-thou bullshit.   your hipsters getting their lower Haight cred.  I really thought I would love Molotov's and every time I go there I think I love it, but it's the same lame crowd every time and it's just never fun.  At all.  Even when it's full of my friends.
And my friends are CRAZY fun.  

I hate your broken promises Molotov's.  For shame...  For  shame...

No offence.
author: cecilia k.

description:
I love dive bars...the ecclectic people, the friendly bartenders, the laid-back feel. I do not love this place. The bar itself was o.k. and the bouncer at the door was nice, but the bartender was a complete jerk. First of all, the bar was pretty packed...afterall the Giants had just won game 3 in the series (Go Giants!)...and he was the only bartender. Fine...I'm not too good to wait for drinks. But when there is obviously a line, chatting and joking with your friends at the end of the bar is not acceptable. 

Second, we ordered our drinks and two of us ordered beers on tap. The beers were warm. I don't mean the glass came out of the dishwasher, was hot, and cold beer was poored in. I mean the beer was NOT cold. It was at the temperature normal cold draft beer gets after half an hour of sitting in a warm glass. Gross. One of my friends approached the bartender, told him the beer was warm and asked if any of the other draft beers were cold. The bartender sneered (really sneered!) at him, took the glass, held it in his hands for a second, placed it on the bar and said "The beer is cold." Then he walked away. Wait, what? Are you serious? The rest of my group was awe-struck by his rudeness. What happened to good customer service? Total fail.
author: P J.

description:
Met a friend here a few months ago when I was in town for the weekend. We walked over from Hayes Valley at about 10pm on a Saturday night and sat at the bar, which was a lot of fun. Loud, divey, crowded, but fairly cheap! They had adult swim on the TVs, some of my favorite pinball machines available to play, and good music to boot. 

I mean really, it was a nice change from other places I've been to. I love that people were able to bring their dogs in, and I could chill and play some pinball while drinking a beer with my friend with Dead Kennedys played overhead. Pure bliss.
author: Ashley P.

description:
I really really don't want to like this place. It's a total biker/dive bar with annoying tattooed people that are super sketchy and annoying.

But other than that (hence the one-star deduction), Molotov's really does do everything else right.

They have the strongest drinks in the Lower Haight, while also being quite affordable (4$ for a gin and tonic not during happy hour? Really?), while also having an incredibly nice group of bartenders (also very skilled) who will run after you down Haight Street if you forget your wallet.

It reminds me why I love the Lower Haight, there'[s so much variety, all of the bars in the Lower Haight are so different from each other yet each one has a certain time and place when it's right.
author: Mark A.

description: Agree with all the other complainers about this place. Aside from the fact that this is a mediocre dive bar with crappy music, shit atmosphere, and bad drinks, the staff treated us like shit and insulted us, particularly a scrawny white-trash busboy with neck tattooes and short black hair. To the owners of this place: we're never coming back. You might rethink your business strategy before you piss off all of your customers. There are plenty of better places to catch a drink in Lower Haight.
author: Dave R.

description: Last Saturday I lost my wallet at Molotov's, I didn't realize it until Sunday morning when the bar was already closed, so I couldn't call them. After the first 30 seconds of total panic I checked my bank account on line and to my relief, nobody had withdrawn anything. Run to the phone to cancel all my cards and started dreading the week ahead, trips to the DMV, no ATM, and of course the worst of all, the terrifying possibility of identity theft. Less than an hour later they called me to say that Beau, one of the bartenders had my wallet. I got it later that day with absolutely everything in it. I feel so lucky and so very, very grateful. Love to report about honest people.
author: Paula B.

description:
Beaucoup points to the bartenders for keeping up with the crowd.  

When a DYL was called, and happy hour started at 6pm, I thought I was late.  But like the bumper sticker says, "I may be slow, but I'm ahead of you."  It was fun to sit in the back with my $3 PBR draft and watch the crowd drift in.  By 8 pm all of Yelpdom was here, and the bartenders rose to the challenge.  It's not just beer, it's a full bar, and the background music politely stayed in the background.  

Highlights of the evening included making friends with a cat, playing sloppy drunk pool with an equally sloppy drunk pool player (dude, if that woman hadn't given you "the signal" you could have beat me in another five minutes), free beers (Yelpers tend to be generous), lots of conversation with people I vaguely recognized and could look up later, and being shown by a rock star how to quietly slip out during a lull in the action.  

It's a neighborhood bar.  I'll go back if you do.
author: David D.

description:
OK, I ran out of old-school-update room in my original Molotov's review; so here's a newfangled update when one isn't truly justified, at least according to my very extensive, complicated, and needlessly contrived Yelp style manual.

Molotov's has reacquired Medieval Madness.  I think I already told you about that.  But they also replaced The Creature from the Black Lagoon with Avatar.  I don't know how much I'll be playing Avatar, but having a newer pinball machine right next to Medieval Madness means all the Molotov's newbies will be drawn to Avatar and let me play MM in peace.

OK, that's not necessarily true, as yesterday (who knew it was wear-a-Christmas-outfit Saturday?) the place was crammed with drunken idiots at 5 p.m.  I was playing MM; and the group of idiots that had stupidly taken up the spot located conveniently between a column, the ATM, and the pinball machines even though there was plenty of space in the bar were seriously interfering with my pinball-playing.  I can understand accidentally bumping into someone in a crowded bar now and then, but it wasn't that full, and this guy was basically leaning against the pinball machine even though he knew I was playing it.  Every few minutes or so, he would lean back all the way, and I wouldn't be able to play because his butt--literally--had pinned my right hand to the side of the machine.  Asking him to give me room worked, but he didn't apologize, ever, even though he repeated this jerk move at least five times.

Oh, and his friend kept putting his hand on the glass, partially obscuring my view and altering my play.  Why?  I have no idea.  Would you ever lean up against or put your hand on a pool table while people were playing pool?  The answer is no.  So why would you do it when someone is playing pinball?

But none of this is the fault of Molotov's, and the cute bartender is so sweet.  She's always going above and beyond the call of duty, and although I tip well when I buy something, I don't think I've given her nearly enough--money, credit, the affirmation she deserves.  When I learn her name, I'll add it to this review.

UPDATE:  3/25/11
==============

Molotov's is a pinball dream come true once again.  They've replaced Avatar with Scared Stiff.  In case you didn't know, Scared Stiff is the machine I learned my basic pinball skills on in 1997.  And remember, if you're going to play both Scared Stiff and Medieval Madness, play them in that order.  You'll do horribly if you go the other way around.
author: John S.

description:
It's awkward to be the only one in corduroy when everyone else is sporting leather, to carry a briefcase when everyone else is packing a switchblade, to order a martini when everyone else is chasing shots of whiskey with cans of Pabst, and apparently the locals don't see the humor in meek-looking me walking up to a table of seven thuggish hooligans and demanding that they vacate their seats immediately, else risk vexing me to the extent to which I might resort to fisticuffs.

Great Jukebox though.
author: Quinn S.

description:
Hipsters?! 

Someone said hipsters?!! 

 That's stupid. Molotov's is punks. Go for cheap drinks and shots or go somewhere else.
author: Ralph M.

description:
Molotov's is Toronado with less beer snobs, a real liquor license and more Lower Haight hipsters who don't think they're hipsters. We were little more than a travelling Shit Show by the time we stumbled across the street from Noc Noc to Molotov's. 

Things I CAN say about Molotov's even though I was pretty drunkerly by the time we got there:
1. Drinks are STRONG. I puked a little just from the smell of vodka in my vodka-soda. OK, I didn't. But I wanted to.
2. This is not a good place for a pitstop at the potty. Bathrooms are as bad as Noc Noc's and the line seems to go on forever. 
3. This place is large. Good place to take a rowdy bunch if you wish to have your rowdy group's antics go unnoticed.

My favorite part of the night was waiting in the bathroom line (which is where I spent most of my time at Molotov's) singing "Don't Stand So Close to Me" to a miniature Joan Jett look-alike who kept insisting I was (you guessed it!) standing too close to her :)

That was my night at Molotov's. Suffice it to say that in my old and boringer state of late, I was out of there pretty quickly and never looked back. Not really the place I'd choose for a night out but I know many of my friends feel differently, so I'll probably  be back, standing to close to people, waiting in line for the bathroom, and drinking my liver to an early retirement.
author: Autumn K.

description:
When I was in college, everyone was reading Noam Chomsky and the Anarchist's Cookbook. And listening to Fugazi, 7 Seconds, and Bad Religion (you know, before they went commercial maannn). So this bar brought me back to junior year, when I changed my major from biology to political science because I wanted to STICK it to the man, man. 

These days, I prefer to stick it to the man by writing Yelp reviews while I'm at work. And now that the Cold War is over, drinking at Molotov does not seem so iconoclastic. Although going there on a school night seems a bit naughty.
author: Suzanne R.

description:
After a full night of bar hopping my friends and I decided to trek on over here for our last coveted hour of drinking. Good thing it was a Thursday because it does tend to get pretty crowded on the weekends. 

Darkish bar wth a pool table and your typical lower Haight crowd. I would have scored it higher, as I have had some decent evenings here over the years, but they pissed me off.

This is a bar, my friends, where people drink! When drinking is taking place people get sloppy...sometimes a drink spills, sometimes a glass breaks. You appoligize and move on. I repeat, this is a bar, not a freakin country club.

So, one of my friends dropped a glass, apologized etc, etc. He got lectured as if he had done it on purpose and the dude acted like my friend was one step away from being 86ed. Get real! Low ratings to that dude, and the bar, for crying over spilt milk (or beer....whatever!).
author: Drue C.

description:
Discharge+Beer+Molotov's=Spending Loud Drunk Night.
Nice location, 71 bus right in front, cheap beer, great bartenders and people all around. Infestation of hipsters once in awhile...that is what the jukebox is for.
Enough said.
author: Zach L.

description:
What is it with this place? Is Molotov's some kind of black-out vortex. I must say I take great pleasure in getting kicked out of bars, but how many times do I need to get kicked out of this place before they learn their lesson. 

There is one thing to know about me. I am a very irresponsible drinker and I honestly could care less. The problem is that places like Molotov's, with their 3 dollar shots of tequila and $2 PBRs, are just setting themselves up for drunken debauchery such as very loud, obnoxious...your my best friend/I hate you type behavior. Plain and simple.

Not only that, but that jukebox... One of my favorites in the city. Everything from Guns N Roses to the Ramones to Pantera to Mike Patton to whatever the hell floats your boat, unless you are a Backstreet Boy loving freak of nature (this is the nice way of saying you wouldn't fit in very well at this bar). Therefore...

Mixing tequila and hearing music where the entire bar constantly is hearing you saying (screaming) "That's my song!" as you walk by hugging everybody is a pretty good indicator that you will wake up the next morning saying...what the fuck happened?? The answer is I don't want to know. It's cool.
author: LisaMarie C.

description:
OK, yes, I know. I'm old. I'm resentful. I'm a European, cranky bitch who likes to consider her dive bar as her own living room.

Which is why I still haven't forgiven the ass that bought the Midtown and turned it into this junk hole, Molotov's. Don't get me wrong, the Midtown also was a pretentious, punk rock dive, but contrary to Molotov's it had:
* a good jukebox
* friendly and cool bartenders - yes  it's not an oxymoron - who the new owner fired even though all neighborhood regulars signed a petition for him to keep the staff on (betcha you miss Wendy et all now, reading the reviews of the douche bags you got working there now)
* drinks that were actually drinkable. Having one of the only liquor licenses in the area does not entitle you to make watered down, crappy cocktails.

So, it may have been ten years, but I'm still ready to bring the Midtown back and to punish Molotov's  for ruining a great dive bar by giving them only one lousy star.
author: Tatjana G.

description:
Lisa W., at Toronado: "I'm too broke for Chimay. Let's go to Molotov's."

Lisa W., at Noc Noc: "This place only has beer and I'm not drunk enough and the furniture makes my legs fall asleep and I'm not on drugs and the torpedo with the gas mask is not amusing me. Let's go to Molotov's. NOW." 

Lisa W., at Danny Coyle's: "This place has soccer and everything, but I can't watch soccer in a bar with framed art on the walls. CUSTOM-framed art. Fxxx soccer. MOLOTOV'S!" 

If I'm in the Lower Haight, I really don't wanna be anywhere else besides Molotov's. I will annoy the crap out of you until we end up there. Don't test me. 

Seriously -- if you're a dive bar luvah like myself, just skip the rest, and head for the flaming bottle. 

You can't go wrong with a FLAMING BOTTLE.
author: Lisa T.

description: I have mixed feelings about this place.  Tables by the front windows make for great people watching and are a great spot, especially on the rare warm night.  And, it's practically the only decent bar in this immediate neighborhood that serves liquor, so sometimes I end up going there by default, when I'm with friends who won't drink beer.  But... I never have a very good time there.  The drinks are cheap, but the drinks are weak, and the beer selection is poor.  The staff is almost always unreasonably rude (keep in mind that I've 5-starred other dive-y bars that are known for their surly staff -- Molotov's aren't just brisk, they just pretty much ignore you and then give you grief when they do take your order).  Weirdly, the only times they've been pleasant to me have been when I was way too drunk...
author: Heidi M.

description:
I try to refrain from reviewing anything after the second bar I visit on a night out. This is because I'm old and boring, and by the time we hit our third bar I'm usually bored and ready to leave and this colors my impressions of these establishments. I'm trying to be fair but keep this in mind.

Molotovs has dirty bathrooms and lower haight scenesters, but so do Toronado and Noc Noc.
