However, they also have a full bar and a decent amount of standing room and a pool table; Neither of the other bars can boast all of these, or Mad Dog in the Fog for that matter. (Mad Dog is also pretty short on scenesters these days also.) 

So I guess that would make Molotov's the default choice for boozing on Haight between Steiner and Fillmore. If you're craving a tripel brewed by trappist monks in a cave in Wallonia head to Toronado, and if you want to listen to a live DJ while sitting in a nightmarish circus tent then you'll want to go to Noc Noc, but otherwise Molotov's isn't a bad place to start.

Something about the place rubs me wrong but I'm pretty sure it's just me. If you're not boring like I am you'll probably be ok with it.
author: matthew r.

description:
This place could have been fun but instead turned into a very unfortunate and highly unnecessary experience!

When I hear last call at a bar, my understanding is it's your last chance to buy some alcohol for you and your friends with an additional 15 minutes or so to consume the just purchased beverages before the bar closes down for the night. Right? Well at Molotov's I guess their policy is "Come purchase some drinks and immediately after you get your drinks, get the fuck out!" 

I purchase a round of beers for myself and three other friends and immediately after I brought the beers to them we were harassed by the staff to "drink faster and get out now." I understand this is a dive bar and you learn to except a little more attitude at places like this but it's totally UNACCEPTABLE when you have three staff members harassing and pushing to start a fight with you and your friends for simply not chugging our beers once they were just purchased!!

Molotov's will NOT be visited again. There are far too many great bars in SF to waste your time at a place where they have little respect for their customers.
author: Eddie L.

description:
I've lived in the neighborhood for a decade and it took me 6 years to finally try out Molotovs.  It's now my local bar.  The bartenders are great.  It's a unique mix of customers, but it all works.  Some weekend nights it's too pack with tourists, but everyone is generally friendly.  When lucky, the tvs have bad movies and soccer.  Check out the specials board, some good deals are found there.  I wish their happy hour ran a little later, but I'm often able to grab it just as it ends.

I wish the bathrooms were labeled more like El Rio, but hey, it's the Lower Haight.
author: Ken R.

description:
This place is definitely just a bit below A-OK... totally skeezy dive! Alcohol was involved, so of course I've had some good times here, but I'm not proud of it.

I had a lovely exchange with a girl who came into the restroom with me. I forget why she was there... but she took some pictures with me to send her girlfriend. They were PG pictures, I swear.

I also played a *mean* game of bones here. Kick ass! I won me two dollars that night. Didn't get stabbed. Even better!

As others have said, I am not punk enough for this bar.
author: Ben Y.

description:
Three Words: FLEX YOUR HEAD

In describing Molotov's, I could detail how skeevy it is (I'm still itching from sitting on that felt-covered bench and I am praying all my Hep A-B vaccines from my trip to China a decade ago will protect me from drinking draught beer from their tap), but I won't. Though I had a blast here (more on that later)--nothing else than FLEX YOUR HEAD matters.

Molotov's has Flex Your Head, a Dischord records compilation. I am shocked that anyone outside of DC or who doesn't bleed harDCore (that's DC hardcore to the uninformed) like I do would have this AMAZING  compilation of the birth and prime years of the harDCore movement.  That is the biggest star maker in the YELP universe , in my opinion.

In addition to the cool points cache that Flex Your Head brought Molotov's, this all happend on an early Sunday evening: I got some shockingly-astute and intelligent advice (and a come-on) from an "adult entertainment" professional--thanks C!; I helped my friend and a dirty, sexy punk boy hook-up; I got spritzed with water (not intentionally) by a tall Johnny Thunders lookalike (I'm a glam rock groupie so I didn't mind in the least); and met some crazy yet strangely sweet people.  All of that equals a stellar place and a fun night for me.

One star docked because I am still scratching my head from leaning on that bench.  But I'll deal because I'm f*cking (DC) hardcore like that.
author: MakeUp M.

description:
I hate this place so much I don't even want to walk in front of it for fear the dirty negative attitude might rub off on me.  Oh wait, it did, every time I went in. Someone's always giving you a sideways glance and I always walk out wanting to punch someone. 'nuff said.

Edit: 3.5 years later and their rating goes from one star, to three. The place has grown on me. What is even better, is when you can go in there during the day, in the middle of the week. Perhaps it was the late night attendees that were rubbing me the wrong way. Cheers.
author: Norma ..

description:
Very very good bartenders - I like my drinks girly and fruity, but still potent, and Molotov's definitely got me giggling all night long.  Well, at least until midnight when we decided to stumble back home.  Anyway, glad to find a cool bar in the Lower Haight!

P.S. Don't try to buy a strawberry flavored condom from the bathroom - it'll eat your 50 cents. :(
author: Laura W.

description:
The fact that they have a $2 Mickey's Malt Liquor special is enough to make me want to sob with joy.

Too bad the bartender was some strewn out heroin addict prick.  I guess he didn't like my cardigan sweater.
author: Rocco B.

description:
This bar makes me angry.  Don't glare at me because I shop at Banana Republic, bitches.  I only wear preppy corderoy blazers to confuse you.  I'm not big on the bars where the clientele and the bartenders cop a hipper-than-thou attitude.  

Ok, fine, let's be honest: the real reason I don't like Molotov's is because I used to go here with my asshole ex-boyfriend and his asshole friends.  Plus some French chick hit on him in front of me.  Come on now, everyone knows that if you're going to make a move on a taken man, you at least wait until his lady friend goes to the bathroom.
author: Jess T.

description:
When an evening bike ride with two lovely ladies goes wrong, what do you do? GET A FAT TIRE!

We were supposed to meet at Duboce Park, by 6:30pm. Yeaaaah...guess I didn't get the memo about the meeting time changing to 7pm.  

Turns out her phone was broken so our other counterpart had no idea if we were even at the park. Finally we got in touch with her, and had already strolled up Steiner to Lower Haight. It was now 7:30, foggy & getting darker by the minute. 

The decision was made that Molotov's would take precedence this particular evening over a cold & wet ride. We sat around and enjoyed some Fat Tires (one of my favorite beers) & music, and chatted for awhile. 

While Molotov's isn't my favorite bar of all-time, it's a great punk rawk neighborhood dive & with the right mix of people it becomes even better. I have brought friends/dates here on other occasions & the general consenus is that it kicks ass. The most interesting part is the neighborhood--lots of eccentric people wandering around.

And it has video games! Yay video games in a bar!

Oh, and girls... if your reading this...you know my spandex bike undershorts turns you on!
author: matt m.

description:
A little history lesson: waaay back in the day this joint was called "Rainforest" or something, and was very "tropical". Then it morphed into "Midtown", and became quite the destination. Eventually, it evolved into the lovely dive it is now, and that's a good thing. Cool people and cheap drinks are always a great recipe for fun.

I go through phases of not coming to this place for months, even years, but when I do, it's always a good time. On two recent visits, I ran into a bartender friend (who hooked me up, thank you) and several other pals and peeps I know from around town. I also made a new friend, who had some seriously killer dank that he willingly shared.

Nice.

I also had a couple good pool games, which got noticed by a couple of the competitors who wanted to take me on. However, I was with a friend, and she kinda had my attention, so I had to lay down my weapon to hang with her. Too bad, because I always play well on the table here. But a guy's gotta do what a guy's gotta do, y'know?
author: ACE A.

description:
PINBALL MACHINES!!! In front!! 
NOT hidden in the back corner so they smell like bathroom. YAY!!!!!!

Good, decent bar, spacious area. I was drunk so I can't explain much else.
author: Jessica L.

description:
The fact that is has LOTR pinball says it all.  Great bar, I wish it was in Long Beach.  Of course, then it might not be such a great bar.    

I only wish the pinball machines had been plugged in.  Sigh.  When I went by the next day someone was playing, so I was TSOL on the LOTR.  

4 rather than 5 stars for being dog friendly, and for the no pinball for the wicked factor.
author: Stephanie F.

description: Cheap enough. Decent jukebox. But, man, what a shithole...also, there's not much seating so be prepared to stand around with your drink in one hand and your dick in the other...
author: Morris D.

description:
OK, it's been a while and I feel like I need to update my review of this bar.  Over the last year, the reasonable amount of cool people who hang out here have seemed to evaporate, only to be replaced by a bunch of tight-jean and bullet belt wearing assholes with nothing better to do than look malnourished and judge anybody with flesh colored skin visible thru their ink .  Apart from Stephanie (who is great!) the bartenders are the biggest assholes in the bar.  

Now that I no longer live around the corner, this bar probably won't make my regular rounds quite as often any more.  Oh well.
author: matt c.

description:
Moving to the West Coast from the East Coast, I had to adjust to different expectations in how a city is laid out. I assumed that nothing of interest could be more than a few blocks from a subway stop (surface transit didn't count). But much of the good stuff in SF is clustered in neighborhoods away from the transit hubs, and away from all the places that casual tunnel travelers would see without one or two Muni transfers. Sometime around 2002, I started spending time in the Lower Haight, and stuck around as a regular visitor for about four years. 

After the demise of An Bodhran, Molotov's and Toronado are what hold my interest. Despite other comments to the contrary, I've always found this place to be rather friendly. Pleasant bar staff, reasonably quick service, moderate prices, functional restrooms with no lines, non-aggro clientele (except the one time I had to help mediate a fight between amputees--but hey, it's still the Lower Haight). A visit for Friday's DYL confirmed that, despite changes in the neighborhood (some for the better, some for the worse because they're for the better), the overall experience is still the same. If they could only flush the tap lines a bit more...

One of the best things about the gentrification of the Lower Haight is the humor in watching the younger, overcoiffed/business-casual folks (non-Yelpers!) walk into a not-so-divey dive bar like Moly's and do the look-around-fold-arms-pull-bag-in-close thing like it's a seriously edgy place. Meh. It's just thrift shop jackets, late 80's alternative music, and maybe  some Walgreens hair die. Really.
author: Matt R.

description:
This place is pretty neat. It has genuine dive bar decor, the juke box is filled with good music, and bar tenders that know their job and keep up with the crowd.

I do have a concern. At least the night I was there, for a DYL, their kegs seemed to be have been consistently too warm by at least 10 degrees. I had three different beers on tap, so it wasn't a case of a particular keg being too warm. 

I'd be willing to go back, and give them another chance on the beer, which could lead to another star in the future.
author: neil c.

description: Molotov is a "Cash Only" hipster bar in the Haight.  They serve very few good beers on tap, along with....Hamm's canned beer.  One can only wonder what hard alcohol they carry.  This was totally not my scene.  One visit to Molotov is enough.
author: Camille K.

description:
When I need a cheap Pabst Blue Ribbon this is where I go. 

Not the only place I go.

But certainly one of the places.

Also, I feel like there is always some strange character loitering outside..but then again it is lower Haight so that should be expected.
author: Catrinel A.

description:
As my co-worker said to me the other day, let's face it.  Molotov's is the only bar in Lower Haight.  

I have a soft spot for shitty punk bars.  I'll make that concession.  I like most of the music they play, the people pretty much stay out of your way, and the prices are usually low.  

But seriously guys, let's do the rundown.

Toronado - 40 year old men trying to find a place to belong by wolfing down sausages and drinking exotic, not-actually-that-exotic beers.  Bartenders are so intentionally grouchy and self-obsessed it ceases to make any sense.  I swear to god sometimes they'll say shit like "This ain't the type of place that'll wet your lower lip until the tap runs dry."  #%&*?!

Noc Noc - Continue down the block to find no liquor again, this time with about 4 kinds of beer and a fridge full of cider.  Thanks for making the seats too low - if I want to avoid leg cramps I'll definitely snag one of the 3 seats at the bar.  Bill says it's like the last two hours of a bad acid trip.  I bet that's true.

Mad Dog - It feels like a high school gym in here, and there's still no liquor.  

An Bodhrain - Awesome!  Oh wait, you got shut down and savagely remodeled into a cheap knockoff mall bar.  Danny Boyle's, there are flies in your raspberry mojitos, you're ugly and tacky, and you will fail.

So who reigns supreme?  The place where you can actually get a shot or a mixed drink, listen to motorhead, play pinball, sit in a booth, accidentally bump into someone without having a fucking conversation about it, and get wasted without consequences.  If you're northwest of church and market and southeast of Oak and Divis, and you're not at Molotov's, you're lost.
author: Nick P.

description:
When i first visited SF from NY, this was the first bar I was in that I actually liked. It was a little punkier then and not nearly as clean as it is now. But i distinctly remember the bartenders being more than awesome. I wasn't dressed the way they were and no one gave a rats ass......me or them.

Now they've cleaned it up a bit and the staff is a little more "professional."

Just as fun but they're on top of their game. The prices are great. the bathrooms are a C-. There is food on almost every corner and they've got several pinball machines. 

You can shoot some pool. Or lounge around with a decent sized group. and you won't run into any pacific heights or marina types. It's gonna be lower haighters all the way.

They give a good pour and there is always some cult flick on the tele.

Give it a shot......you won't walk away dissapointed
author: Michael O.

description:
WELCOME BACK FROM HAWAII!!!! (Screaming Jill S. friends)
Now let's do a bunch of blow and proceed to get shit-faced.  
Cut to today and me dragging ass home at 11am.  With errands to do.  Having NO SLEEP.
HURT SAUCE
Thanks a lot Molotov's!  Your $2 Pabst ensured I was liquored up.  Your ample bathroom space made sure I was blown up.  And your douchebags outside made sure I was looked up (and down).  
Now I'm going to pop a couple Excedrins, get another 12 hours of sleep and try to ignore my friends' solicitations for partying again tonight.
Oh crap...I'm going back to Hawaii next week too...which means ANOTHER Molotov's Welcome Back Party.  I don't think I'm going to survive the month of October.
author: Jill D.

description:
love this place, yes they are cool with my dogs, and everyones dog, but don't be that person who's dog takes a shit in the middle of the room. definitely not cool.

Don't judge get to know the regulars they are all pool sharks and are all very interesting.  I might not fit into the "crowd" here but it's never made me feel uncomfortable at all.  

Cheap bear and awesome specials, the bartenders are cool and will tell the creep that's hitting on you over and over again to beat it, and I like that.
author: Diana D.

description:
The men's bathroom at Molotov's makes the joint. Located indiscretely at the back of the bar, it's perhaps a ten-by-ten room, remarkably stench free, as I recall.

The door does not fully close, much less lock. Once inside the men's room by way of a gentle nudging, you are greeted by a sink, a toilet, and a urinal. Thankfully, I did not need to use the toilet, as I just could not see myself squatting while some drunk punk crashes through the door directly in front of you (jamming it open, of course, as that would be my luck), and stumbling over to relieve himself two feet to your left.

This has the perhaps unintentional side effect of transforming the men's room into the women's room by random girl grabbing nearest patron / tattoo'ed nightclub security reject to act as bouncer in front of the door. To get into the women's room, you need to grab a key from the bar, and the men's room is freely accessable. 

Every square inch of the restroom is covered in Marks-A-Lot graffiti of the typical variety. Unfortunately, it's not nearly as interesting or captivating as the stickers that plaster every vertical surface in the bar proper. But then again, who's really all that witty while pissing away cheap bar and whiskey? The time to be witty is the first stage: the drinking.

If this doesn't bother you, feel free to wander down for a cheap PBR or five. By the time you're done, you'll need the restroom. I liked it enough here to happily visit twice in 18 hours.
author: Paul B.

description: I feel like this "punk rock" bar is less "punk rock" than other "punk rock" bars in the city.  Yeah everybody's in a black hoodie and has a neck tattoo and it's a bit of a sausage fest but I'm pretty sure my mom could take them all.
author: Ryan P.

description:
Many hours later, as he quaffed his Spaten at Noc Noc, Andy was to remember the fateful moment when Wes took him to discover Molotov's.

Oh, wait, no he wasn't.  He had already forgotten we had even gone there.  And how can you blame him?  It's a forgettable bar in a neighborhood of memorable ones.
author: Wes M.

description: If you want hang out but don't have much budget...here the place!!!..The Happy Hour not bad either
author: Marsaulina V.S V.

description:
I went for a birthday surprise drink-a-thon and my experience is probably colored by the fact that I actually found parking right across the street. 

Dive Bar, not a lot of service and that was A-ok. We gathered in the booth up front and the PIBs (people in Black) were nice to us. 

If you get loud and rowdy, no one cares, 'cause you are competing with the punk music background. That means, you gotta be pretty darn rowdy to be even noticed.

Yeah, it is a hipster/goth/punk sorta place and if you show up in pastels talking about re-runs of Friends, you won't be well received. First of all, you are prolly too old if you are talking about Friends with enthusiasm and finally, you overshot your destination and should've ended up in the Marina. 

But I liked the place and would def go back for another meetup with like minded souls, even if they do look like they were just dearly departed.
author: Miel H.

description:
When the Toronado is just a bit too loud, too bright and too hectic, and I fear for my dog's life since she's liable to be trampled under so many many many careless drunken staggerings, or slopped dripping wet with a bit too much sloshed beer, I head over to Molotov's. There, generally, I can sit in the dark with the pup and the boy, sip my fernet, and feel, amazingly enough, almost tranquil.

(Like the Toronado, outside food is welcome -- or at the very least -- ignored.)
author: Claudine C.

description:
I come here for the cheap PBR ($2/bottle) and the smokin' neck-tatted door-guy. 

And the music.

And the rad movies they play at the bar.

And the pool table.

And the pin-ball.

And all of the super-cute "punk" boys in tight jeans.

Yes, this is a good neighborhood bar to have.
author: Danyell K.

description: boo cash only. yay awesome tamale lady.
author: Misha T.

description:
"Excuse me."

*"Oh!  Sorry!  Shit, lemme buy you another..." *To be used when you spill your drink or someone else's on a stranger; PS - this will most likely happen here 'cause it is almost always crowded... er, maybe I'm just the biggest klutz in town?

"Are these your quarters?"

The above phrases are frequently uttered by me at this place.  Pretty much every time I'm here.  Yes, I am a klutz and I'm usually the one who spills the drink of the night, usually on someone else, and usually when I'm not even partially drunk yet.

They only have one pool table so don't expect to bogart it all night okay?  They also have a nice range of pinball machines near the front so your friends named Dan H. are always entertained.

I always like to take my from-waaaay-out-of-town friends here because of the awesome mixture of people who tend to show up here.  I am always fascinated by their responses to our lovely diverse culture:
"Was that a man?"  me: "No that was a woman."

"Was THAT a woman?  We don't see people like this in Tracy."  me: "Yes.  Now she is.  You should move."

"Huh?"  me: "Oh, they're probably going to Burning Man next week."  them: "What's Burning Man?"  Oh lord!  My friends are so entertaining!

I love the Lower Haight.
author: Ashleigh K.

description:
The Lower Haight doesn't really have many dive bars.

I hear you calling me an idiot, but think about it.

Toronado is like the brewer's alehouse.  SF Underground seems more like a club.  Mad Dog is like a legit "pub".  Noc Noc is... well... Noc Noc.

So it's good to have Molotov's right the midst of it all.  It doesn't get much divier than this.  Dogs, crazy art on the wall, low red lights and enough people wearing black and/or metal to make you ask: "what band is that guy in?"  The beer selection is pretty good, definitely above average with Full Sail, Prohibition and Boddington's on tap.  For those of us on a budget, they even have High Life and PBR in bottles.  

The seating is fairly limited so if you're planning on sitting down you may want to rethink your destination.  Also props on having an ATM in the bar so I don't have to use that seedy ATM on Fillmore and Haight.

I have many fond (i.e. blurry) memories of coming here for that last beer or shot of Jameson and for the longest time thinking this place was in the Mission.  If all else fails, there are about 6 bars within a block.
author: Steven R.

description: Fun. No hassle. Interesting peeps, and all pretty respectful folks.
author: Em L.

description:
Persistent, stale odor that can be smelled from outside, crappy pool table, skimpy, water-down mixed drinks, bartenders with more attitude than brains...what's there to love about this place?  There are plenty of other bars all over San Francisco and in The Haight in particular that caters to a clientele that lives on the edge or on the fringes of society that have a lot more to offer.

I am giving this place one star only because the name is cool.

Note to the bartenders: Customers are the people who are paying your salary.  It does not mean that you have to act like Ned Flanders from The Simpsons on Valium, but it doesn't mean that you should treat the customers who don't meet your downwardly mobile criteria like crap and ignore them for ten minutes while they are waiting for a drink when the bar is mostly empty.
author: Rick E.

description:
I own the entire Fugazi and Bikini Kill discography, but lemme tell you:

I am NOT punk rock enough for Molotov's.  

And neither are you.  

And neither are your friends.  

And neither is the majority of the crowd who frequents this place on any given weekend night.  

BUT if you love the sweet, sweet stench of intermingled whiskey, cigs and piss and your ideal of hotness involves spikes, tats, and all black ensembles, this is the place for you.   Just remember to pee before you come and do not touch anything (both mobile and immobile).
author: Thuy L.

description:
The awesome thing about this place is they let dogs wander, and there's a juke box and pinball.

The REALLY AWESOME thing about this place is the grossest bathroom experience I've ever had.
author: Yeeman N.

description:
A dog-friendly dive bar (more like, the diviest dive bar ever)? I can dig it. I had so many free shots of Fernet that night, that I would probably do a better review of the bathroom than I would the actual bar. But it was the first time I had been that shitfaced-drunk since my high school prom! It's easy to stay sober when you have to pay for your own drinks. I passed out on the BART.

Bill, one of the bartenders there, has the most beautiful dogs I have ever seen. They lay on each other and drink beer from shot glasses while sitting at the bar. That's enough reason to go right there.
author: Taryn B.

description:
Molotov's is just crusty enough for me.  

I like the jukebox, the people inside are fun to watch, and they actually have some cool paintings on the wall.

I took off a star because I can get my usual drink at Deliruim for a dollar less.  

Absolute greyhound @ Molotov's:  $5
Absolute greyhound @ Delirium:  $4 

But Molotov's is closer, so I'll take it!
author: Alice S.

description: Cheap drinks! Although, the bartender somehow managed to not hand my ID back to me correctly and I ended up without a license, at my friend's house in Oakland at 11pm with a flight to Vegas early in the AM.  I had to go all the way back to SF to get my passport.  Nightmare of a night.  Make sure you get your ID back!
author: Kacie O.

description:
Tall skinny bartender wearing all black with a studded belt and face.

Every square inch of the beams and walls covered in stickers making obscure references to obscure punk bands.  Where the walls do show through it's old dark wood.  Tables and chairs are also old dark beer stained wood.

Bathroom decorated with stickers and grafitti.

pool table.

I love this bar!  The bartenders were wonderful as my throbbing head can attest to this afternoon.  It's a great local dive bar and I felt very much at home here.

I'm sure I'll wind up here again, and next time I'll pay more attention to the jukebox.
author: Theron L.

description:
Oh God I hadn't been there since my days of punk rock, bad choices and seedy guys. My first time back in a long time and it felt like slipping back into my Mohawk and studs.....F*CKIN RIGHT ON!!! PBR still dirt cheap (DUH) shots come and go at your leisure and if your lucky, some guy hocking useless camel stuff outside will give you a free lighter!!

Oh yeah Ill keep coming back when I need a reality check and want to run into old friends I haven't seen in ages......Have I changed since then...You're damn right I have, oh don't let the pink hair tattoos and piercings fool you I am a big girl now but still as hardcore as ever....Well underneath the squishy marshmallow outer shell anyways
author: Shaunna K.

description:
This is my bar.  

I might eventually get eighty-sixed for medicating too close to the front door (I'm sorry bro, I was drunk and thought I was further over) but even that wouldn't affect my opinion of this place negatively.

The people who complain about the cheap booze... shouldn't buy it.  Most standard and luxury brands of liquor are available here, so if you buy a well drink and get Taka vodka in it buck the fuck up, or better yet don't be so fucking cheap and buy some real booze.

I regularly drink pints of Newcastle and glasses of bourbon here while reading, writing or just enjoying the interesting spectrum of people who frequent this incredible establishment.  The bartenders are, from my experience, all very capable if not all overly polite, with some being genuinely warm and courteous.  If you don't come in with a bunch of fucked up attitude, chances are you will not receive any.

I'm not a punk by any stretch of the imagination, and I always feel right at home at Molotovs.  Their jukebox ranges from the expected punk and metal selections (as well as some unexpected ones) to reggae standards.  They have James Brown, Nina Simone and in addition to other hip hop and rap, Wutang and Public enemy.  I would wonder about someone who couldn't find a song to listen to on that machine.

They have chess and other board games behind the bar for those nights when you decide to post up for the evening and eat take out food from any of the surrounding restaurants at the bar's comfortable table booths.  They have a pool table, naturally, and I 'm pretty sure the door actually closes on the women's bathroom if not the mens.

Pinball is a huge bonus, and if you can get on it, try the Lord of the RIngs machine they got recently.  The multi-ball on that shit is bad.  The only thing really missing from this place right now is a dart board an me.  

I'm going to fix that this instant.
author: Hebrew K.

description:
Only been here once, after dinner with a pack of folks down the street at Naan & Chutney. It really pained me to walk PAST Toronado to hit this spot instead, but this is where everyone wanted to go.
The beer selection didn't knock me out, as they only had one beer on that I would actually pay to drink: Lagunitas IPA, and it tasted like they'd watered it down.  However everyone else seemed to enjoy their cocktails, and the be-stickered surfaces made for good conversation starters. 
For some reason I got onto a tangent of spouting random quotes from The Big Lebowski whilst sitting there admiring the stickers, but then again, it never seems to take much to get me going on that. 
Location seems to be one of the main reasons why this spot thrives, but for my beer-drinkin' dollars, I'd rather brave the crowds at Toronado across the street.
author: Melissa L.

description: This place totally sucks. Hope you enjoy sausage, cuz that's all they're serving.
author: Chris S.

description: Bad ass bar with bad ass juke box also bad ass prices and a bad ass hamm job if you ask for one. Parking absolutely sucks tho. Bartenders and dude at the front of the bar are "very straight forward" so don't be a preppy kid expecting a pat on the back and constant pampering. Awesome surrounding area. Go Niners!
author: Napoleon C.

description:
I'm not the typical Molotov patron, but I have only fond memories of this place.  Despite being a suburban prepster in the city, the bartenders have never given me or my friends the "you're not from around here" brush-off.  In particular, Kevin (a Molotov legend in his own right) kept the drinks flowing and even acted as photographer when one party-goer posed in his birthday gift - a classic radio flyer wearing a doggy bowl for a hat that was bought from a homeless man.  To this day, I still have no idea what that drunk bastard was thinking in that red wagon, but the pictures are priceless.

Admittedly I've run into some gruff service in my visits to the bar, but I accept it as a bar staying true to itself.  If you want plush seating and refined surroundings, the Marina is a short cab ride away.
author: Drew W.

description:
So I went to an international high school in India. My buddies and I thought we were so punk rock. We skateboarded. We were in India's best (only?) punk rock band, The Perms. And we ordered most of our music from Lookout! Records catalogs and random listings in the back of Punk Planet. This is all pre-Internet, mind you.

And then my senior year my family moved back to the US, and I attended a public high school. I vividly remember walking the halls on my first day, and running into a pack of crusty punk kids. One of them bumped me and said something like, "Watch it, fag". Okay. I guess I was not so "punk rock" after all (nor did I want to be, anymore).

Molotov's takes me back to that experience. Everyone here looks straight out of a Rancid video, and while the jukebox is good, there is only so much scowling I can take. This place just has majorly unhappy and mean vibes.

If you are crust-core or whatever you want to call it, come here to be miserable and hang out with your brethren. Otherwise find a more friendly dive bar in the neighborhood (my vote is to just walk over to Place Pigalle on Hayes Street).
author: Trey F.

description:
Kinda smells.  Kinda dark.  Kinda scary.  

It does what it needs to do, which is offer up booze to Lower Haight locs.

If it did not have the pinball machines, I would never go back.  But it does.  So I will go back.  Damn my pinball addiction!  It makes me do things I wouldn't normally do, like sell my body for quarters.  And go to this bar.
author: Tony A.

description: Too loud and gritty for me. I am too refined.
author: Andrew K.

description:
This place is definitely in need of some more color..and I'm not talkin' about ink. What is it with this place? Why is it that whenever I walk in here I get stared at like half of the guys & half the girls are ready to fight? All I want is a fuckin' Guinness...posers!  

2 stars cuz they serve beer & I get thirsty sometimes...real difficult criteria to meet, sucka asses, so does Chuck E. Cheese's
author: NaN K.

description: This may be a dive, but they have a dog walking around with a bandana on. So, I dig it.
author: Marnie K.

description: A great establishment because that guy Beau is the best bartender is the city.
author: Jack M.

description:
You want a true nasty dive bar (and not the ones people label as dive bars but are actually nice bars) come to Molotov's.  This is where all the Sid Vicious wannabes hang out at and be more Sid Vicious-like.  

Last time I was there I decided to throw a little loop into everybody's world by throwing on some hip hop in the juke box since the only thing playing the whole damn night was heavy metal, punk, or bad indie rock music.  So I decide to put on the whole Wu-Tang 36 Chambers album.  That was fun to see all the Johnny Rotten wannabes have that look of "Why in the hell is this crap on?"  Hey, if you don't like the selections I put on don't have it in the jukebox for me to choose it.  Also, this is also a good place for all you junkies looking to score.  Pretty apparent this place seems to be a meeting ground for the slinger and the user.  Don't be bringing your family or square friends here....you might scare em off!!
author: David C.

description:
Yup, standard divey goodness. 

 I had a friend who was ALWAYS at Molotov's playing pool no matter what time or when I called him.  He and I hung out frequently so I inevitably found myself there quite often.

It's the only place on that block of Haight St. that serves hard liquor.  We also used to kickit at the Noc Noc and then head over to Molotov's just for a warm up shot of whiskey in between.

There's nothing wrong with a little Molotov's but I don't usually go out of my way to frequent here.
author: Shayna N.

description:
The discreet charm of surly monosyllabic cro-magnons.
The mystique of urine inundated bathroom floors.
Le Parfum de Vomit.  
Don't forget your hip-waders.
author: David F.

description:
I think my four stars is primarily based on the jukebox. This jukebox has zounds, battalion of saints, cocksparrer and void. Ergo...it stands on its own as legit. 

The bar tenders are usually cool. The pool table is well lit. The drinks are cheap. There's usually plenty of seating. 

Clientele seems like a lot of tattooed waiters and hair dressers that are supposed to be hip. Most of my experiences are of people being relatively standoffish, but not particularly rude either. I remember having a lot of fun on halloween weekend here when more square types came out of the woodwork. Those people were nice and that shit was fun. I wish more people like that would go to this bar.

I also like that they have one of those game machines at the bar. However, I've never played it so I don't know if it has that game with different pictures of naked women and you have to point out the differences.
author: Matt P.

description:
Living 3 blocks from this place use to be my local, I could:
Put a buck in the juke box and listen to Sam Cooke, The Pogues, Biggie and The Clash.
Play pinball
Get a fernet with a high life back for 6 bucks
Get PBR on tap or in bottles.

One of the bartenders would let you guess the card under the cap of the pbr to win a free beer. 

Never did win that game...
author: Kenneth S.

description:
Been a while since I was in here - I just remember it being like a cave that had been given too many coats of glossy paint and it was TOO LIGHT so the walls were a little shiny. Like flourescent.

This is going to date me in a really embarrassing way, but back in the day, back when I was too poor for anything other than piss beer, my friends and I used to hit a whole slew of punk bars in the Lower East Side. they had three things in common -- cheap beer, LOUD LOUD LOUD CAN'T HEAR YOURSELF THINK music, and this sort of living (cheap beer and dirty surface-enhanced) dimness.

This joint aspires to something but doesn't pull it off. And the something isn't much to start with.
author: Karsten P.

description:
With the relentless gentrification machine in high gear these days, it's getting harder and harder to find a punk-friendly bar. (Indie hipster joints don't count, because so much indie rock is just plain weak and listless.) So it's always great when places like Molotov's are around.

Cheap prices. Hardcore jukebox. Pool table and pinball. And occasionally a hot mohawk girl perched on a barstool. These are all good things.

If there's anything I don't like about Molotov's, it's that it isn't quite punk enough. It needs less lighting, more graffiti, more band stickers, ripped old show flyers, and that slightly threatening aura you feel at a hardcore hangout. Maybe it's the windows -- they let in too much outside light. A punk bar should really be a black hole with crummy furniture, slummy locals, and at least one postcard punk passed out by the back door.

Until then, I rate Molotov's with four pyramid studs. And the hope that it sticks around for a while.
author: John G.

description:
When it first became Molotovs from being Midtown my friends and I went in there and had a few. Normal neighborhood bar.

Or is it?

For the first 2 years this place was open, each time the 3 of us went in there for drinks we each got the flu or a terrible cold.

Since then when you walk by on an afternoon you can get that fresh aroma of ammonia.

Cleanser?
Needless to say, we haven't caught anything drinking in there for awhile. I suspect they decided to wash everything after a crusty night of barflies.
author: Marz W.

description:
Firstly, they sever hard liquor, and on haight street that is rare.  Woo hoo.

Pinball. Awesome.

If you wear anything other than all black in here, you are an outcast.  That's fun.  

Some bartender said I looked like I was 12 when I got carded.  Thanks for the compliment!

I saw a huge dog attack a blind lady's seeing eye dog  when in  Molotov's.  With the crowd that looms around there, stuff like that is bound to happen.
author: Light Bulb J.

description: Punk crowd.  Dog friendly.  It's okay.  Extra star for serving liquor.
author: Khac L.

description:
Molotovs stinks!  
Like it actually smells in here 75% of the time.

That being said, it's a great dive bar and they usually have some seriously cheap beers on tap and in bottle.  I also love when they open up the front windows so you can do the indoor/outdoor cigarette smoking thing.

I come here as much as I can whenever I have a cold.  
Come to think of it, it's allergy season! Yay! Time for dollar PBRs!
author: Abby M.

description:
I always thought it was one of the place where everybody is wearing a black uniform, talking about how life is so shitty, and ready to kill you. But, no. I went here about couple weeks ago and totally what not my crazy mind expected. 

I was holding my breath ready to get smashed in the head with the punk kids while they're screaming "Oi oi oi!" but no, it didn't happen. I gladly exhaled as I saw some non punk people inside. 

Their gin and tonic was good! I know, it's so weird. The atmoshpehere was friendly and everybody was just chillin'  

Maybe I will come back with friends =)
author: Perry S.

description: It's dark, it's dingy - they serve STRONG drinks and the juke box rocks in all sorts of ironic and amusing ways.
author: Julienne G.

description:
bein a little white girl lackin the tattoos and piercings i felt slightly awkward here, however...
I spent my 21st birthday here and proceeded to to tell EVERYONE in the bar it was my birthday and kept calling it "Mozaltof!" because apparently i'm jewish when i'm drunk or something...
either way. cool vibe. cool bartendars. and cute dogs....ya, i remember dogs.
author: Stacy L.

description:
PBR. Pinball.
Misfits on the jukebox.
word.

Thats this place in a nutshell.
author: Edward C.

description:
I love this dive bar so much I could dive in with a dive stick to dive into a divey drink with Dive McDiverson at which point I could dive happy.

Don't even get me started about their jukebox.
author: Big W.

description:
I'm not sure what everyone's talking about, but I had a really fucking awesome time.  One of the few jukes in the city that has both Notorious B.I.G. and Faith No More in it at the same time? Befriend a mild-mannered pitbull as you're knockin' 'em back?

One thing I really DID notice... the neighborhood locals and bar patrons take good care of this place and those in it if you respect it and them. Example: If someone leaves their cellphone in the bathroom, turn it in to the bartender. The patron who lost it will insist on buying you a drink for finding it, which you will refuse profusely.

I totally swear that happened the FIRST TIME I was there.  So I have NO idea what the hell all of you are talking about.
author: G B.

description:
I have always always always come here. I dont know why but I am a moth to the Molotov flame.

The bartenders are cool (one of the VERY VERY CUTE) and the beer is cheap and I love the jukebox..Oh! and they have pinball and pool! woot woot

I think I come back for the cute bartender...mmm...he is soooo hot!!
author: Keila E.

description:
Should be a lot cooler, but it seems to be a hipster/pseudopunkrock bar.
It doesn't smell very cool either.
author: Tom S.

description: Any dive bar that plays Wu-Tang Clan is good in my book.
author: Kevin G.

description: We were looking for a dirty bar and boy did we find it in Molotov's.  Complete with sort of a bastardy bouncer - when a friend asked if he wanted to see her ID, he responded "No, I'm just sitting out here for fun."  Ha . . . shows her for asking a stupid question.  Their "special drink" was a whiskey and beer (the result of another stupid question).  Scarface being played on one television and Conan the Barbarian on the other.  I'll take it.
author: Jenny R.

description: Really $4 for a strong ass vodka cran and diet coke?  My girlfriend unfortunately was not joining me in my drinking pursuits, but my drink was pretty damn good and cheap as hell.  At first I wasn't sure bout walking into there because I look like such a girlie girl and I figured maybe I wouldn't be welcomed, pretty much what it came down to is they could really give a flying **** if I was there or not, so no one was rude, the enviroment was pretty diverse and it's always awesome when the tamale lady comes in to satisfy my late hour cravings.
author: Rebecca D.

description: Great Cocktails and atmosphere! I hav e frequented this bar for years and in the last year I have found the staff to be much more attentive and fun!  A great place to finish the night in San Francisco
author: Karl K.

description:
I have blacked out once in my life and the last thing I remember doing was getting a shot of whiskey and a beer at this bar.

When I came to, I was almost to Market Street, which is the exact opposite direction of my house.
author: Rachel N.

description: I've been to Molotov's a few times over the years and have always enjoyed it.  Even when it gets crowded, I like the crowd.  My last visit was this past Friday and they have really cleaned the place up.  Paper lanterns?  I hardly recognized it.  Of course that could be based on the fact that in the past I always got black out drunk here.
author: Corey V.

description:
First and foremost, I love the music that ends up playing while I'm here.  I also love grabbing the seat by the window so I can hop in and out if I need to be naughty and light a cigarette.  Cash only, occasionally overly crowded, but especially pleasant during slow times.

Down a star for not having pitchers.
author: Max A.

description:
This is the closest bar to my house.  For that reason alone I really should like this place.  In theory it has all the things I require in a bar:  beer and decent loud music.  Those things alone should shoot Molotov's up to a 4 star rating, but something keeps me from frequenting this place.

I think it is the metal tables.  

Something about the metal tables grates me.  Kinda like nails on a chalkboard, but less obviously awful.

And they have pinball!  I love pinball!

Why don't I like this place?
author: Mat K.

description:
Oh, the days of yore...this bar has held many strange nights for me. It has never smelled nice, it's always too dark and the crowd isn't all that. There was a time when it felt like a community, when Roberto made a football team of the regulars. Simone, Nick and Jess still work there and they are the rad. Otherwise I don't have any reason to go to this watering hole. They do have afternoon live music sometimes, which is a great way to waste time and get drunk! Kinky freaks lurk here, so if you are looking for extra, dirty excitement...
Update: Went here last Saturday, someone played about $20 worth of the Pogues and James Brown, everyone was dancing and happy. It made me ecstatic...until the dumb drunk guys kept bothering us....
author: Colleen B.

description:
I keep coming back here for some reason.  I think its the pinball, or else those strange little metal tables that they've got affixed to the pillars inside.  They always seem a little bit too tilty at first glance, but my glass of beer never falls off the edge.  Think of that as a metaphor.

I can sit and watch a Warriors game on the tv if I'm by myself, or else I can just go down the block and look for some sort of adventure.
author: Gopal R.

description:
This review is more based on the music than the drinks . Sorry. The drinks are standard dive bar, you get them to get drunk then hang out with your friends. I'm sorry, there's no real science behind it. Though a few dudes did get flaming shots, which are more fun to the eye than the taste buds, but I digress.

The reason I've recently discovered I love Molotov's is because of its outstanding jukebox, keeps me entertained and always wanting more. Features a few good punk mixes along with Subhumans, Void, Nina Simone, The Germs, N.W.A, Wu-Tang, Peter and the Test Tube Babies, I could go on, but you get the point. Fun, party jams.

 I know, I know-if it's only the music I care about, I should just drink for cheap at my house while listening to my record player/Ipod, but if I stayed home, I'd never meet that man with carved wooden sticks or that ex-raver, current powerpuff girl 50-year-old cougar in fluffy boots. You know?
author: Emily S.

description: Although i feel like i'm overdressed when i come here on the weekends (and lacking tattoos), I love Molitovs.  The drinks are super cheap!
author: Laura P.

description: Great place to meet interesting people. This place is all about the 80s punk and cheap ass drinks. Don't be intimidated. Play some pinball or pool and get drunk with new friends.
author: christine c.

description:
I'm not punk rock (at least not on the outside -- I'm pretty punk on the inside, promise), but I still LOVE this place. Yes, it looks punk rock, and the bartenders have their little look going, but really, this place is super chill. I've seen all sorts of people here, and everybody gets along just fine. They have a great jukebox (rap and punk... very ironic! But seriously, I love it), always lots of seating, good beer selection, a pool table, pin ball, AND board games to play with your friends! I got hooked on Sorry! for a while, but have since moved on to Connect 4... 

if you're a super judgemental or cliquey (is that a word?) person, Molotov's may not live up to whatever random expectations you may have, but if you just want a cool, chilled out place to get a beer and play some games, this is the place for you.
author: Cindy L.

description:
o.m.g. I ABSLUTTY L.oV.E .MOLLY'Z!!!!!!!!!11111---~~~~~                                                                                                                 v                            vv                    



supah kawaii! n_______n
author: Federico E.

description:
Molotov's is the way a dive bar is meant to be...

Small, dark, dingy, great beer on draft, all the things I love about a dive bar. 
Some of the nicest, friendliest, most down to earth folks I have ever encountered in SF.
No pretension to be found. 

p.s. the touchscreen game will suck you in and eat your soul. I have lost countless hours of my life playing "nudie photo hunt". Don't say I didn't warn you...
author: D H.

description:
five dollar. five dollar. five dollar ketel sodas.





that's a pretty catchy jingle. someone should trademark that.
author: Rachael S.

description:
Problem #1: You need a key to use the women's bathroom. At a bar. At a busy bar. Seriously? Yes. 

Problem #2: The tool in the kangol hat hanging out by the pool tables. Thank you sir, but if I accidentally leave the bathroom door open when I leave it's not super necessary to scream in front of everyone:  "Door! Door! If you need a key, you need to shut the door, honey!" Ugh. Jackass. 

Other than that, it's your standard dive bar. $3 pints, enough standing & sitting room, and chill crowd. Not too bad.
author: Nikki H.

description: Solid dive with some good personality. The Juke is great with enough metal and punk to scare off any d-bags. Random dogs wander around unleashed. The bathroom is sufficiently nasty. They play two different, usually memory lane-staple, movies at once. They have High Life. They have Wild Turkey. Enough said.
author: Mitch G.

description: My friends and I came here after a red eye from the east coast, so it was about 4 am our time. It was a more than adequate--almost required--introduction to San Francisco for us. I consider myself to hold my own in hipster places, but that's in DC, which I've realized once and for all is super duper socially conservative. Or perhaps socially boring is more appropriate. So as I told my friend, I kind of felt as if I walked in with overalls and a piece of hay in my mouth. The cool thing is that it didn't really matter that I looked like a mom who was escorting her teenager to a punk rock concert. I could still enjoy the tunes (at least the ones I recognized, lol) and drink my Srongbow on draft. That alone gets a few stars....my fave, and SO not punk.
author: Christine G.

description:
Jessica T, one of the most highly decorated members of this Yelp Platoon.  Tough act to follow,

Went for the first time last Saturday the 24th of March, must say this is actually the first time i had decided to leave the comfortable confines of the Mission. This was the first stop on roll, and it turned out to be a good reflection of what dive bar should be, the way the Treat ST. once was. The drinks were fair priced, i was glad they only accept cash because i got none on my CARD. The weather sucked but that didnt stop me from gettin messed up. The liquor store next door also deserves some credit, because a few frequent trips outside with a brown bag special is also part of the experience. Reason i only gave three stars,  I made my ass go the Distance.
author: Joe J.

description:
Well, I can't speak to the place on weekends, but I can imagine it getting scary/ugly/rude on Friday or Saturday.

My friends and I visited on Monday. That means we more or less had the place to ourselves for a while... except for a couple awesome bar dogs and their humans.

My favorite element... what really stands out in my mind more than the jukebox, pool or pinball... were the freakish paintings on the restroom doors. Oh, and the door frame ot the men's room was broken so that there was no way to lock it from inside. I could see that becoming problematic on a busy night.
author: Jere K.

description:
-nice people!
-Has booth seats!
-Has pool table!
-7 dollar patron!!

Enough said. I like this place.
author: Wilson L.

description:
This has been a go to spot for me for years.  It's a stumble away from my house, which comes in handy after the type of nights I spend there.  Nick has got to be my favorite bartender.   Not because he's nice or anything, but he's got the perfect attitude for a punk rock bar and he always gives me a nice pour.  

It's a complete dive, so don't be expecting anything but the basics, but it feels like family.  Albeit a totally dysfunctional and disturbing family, but family nonetheless.  It's not the friendliest place, but it's great for a good night of regression and angst.
author: Kelly W.

description:
Not every bar is for you.  If you are too self conscious to enjoy a cheap drink in a dive bar, get over yourself and don't come in.  This is not a hipster bar, most people that frequent this place really don't care enough to be called hipsters.  Sure, the place leans punk, but I don't fit that bill and every one is cool to me and the people I come in with.  It is not the most instantly friendly place, but if you are cool so is every one else.  I have had some of the most intelligent conversations in this bar.  I have also gotten wasted and shouted about things.
Drinks are stiff, decently priced, jukebox is good/on the heavy side

Come in, I'll be drinking a $2 PBR at the bar in the argyle sweater.
author: Sam R.

description:
I think Molotovs is the archetypal dive bar. It's dirty, they don't take credit cards, and you can get a PBR for $2. The crowd here is bizarre, to say the least. Hipsters mixed with punks, chicks from the Marina who are "slummin it" for the night, and dogs. Lots of dogs. Every time I come here there are mutts running between people's legs, I think because the bouncer brings his pets to work with him. 

I have a great time whenever I come to Molotovs, and it's close enough to a few other neat bars that you can do a little lower Haight pub crawl, if you will. It's also pretty easy to get to, right off the 71 and the 6, plus there is a plethora of cabs driving by at all hours. Great place for a low key, no frills night out with friends.
author: Em G.

description: Cool spot. No issues. The whole vibe was straight Good Luck or Drawing Room in LA. So cool people great prices on drinks!!! Would go back when Im up there once again.  Would go back again.
author: MIGUEL R.

description: Love this dive bar....pool table is sweet too and drinks are affordable!  Yum!  Ohh, and pinball...yay!  Good times if you are in the Lower Haight and want a grindy place to hang!  xoox
author: Darby P.

description: 7 dollar patron shots? plus discount cause we were getting 4 of them? HELL YEA! good way to make tip money. $25 for 4 shots of patron, not too shabby, so we came in here twice. :)
author: Melissa C.

description: The bartender chick had her shirt rolled up and she vaulted the bar to say hi to someone.  She said, "I don't like talking about my looks" but it sounded like, "come with me and I will show you wonderful, terrible things."  I have no memory of what she looked like, but I'll never forget her.
author: Matt H.

description: My favorite bar. Great crowd, cool staff, cheap beers, the best jukebox in town, and a pool table where there's always a challenger.
author: Chris V.

description: Good stiff drinks, and a slammin' juke box full of all my favorite grunge smash hits and misses.  Friendly tattooed bartenders,  surly tattooed clientelle (had to break up a fight last time I was there, because it was interefering with my conversation)  - I love the place.  Plus, I can walk there.
author: Joe C.

description:
Hey, can I go down to the store, and, ya know, buy some rebellion?  Once I do that, then where can I hang out while wearing designer jeans, and $200 shoes, but still fit in with other people like me, who can afford $80+ haircuts, and expensive clothes, but pretty much try to "design our look" around the fact that we like the idea of "slumming it" now and again?  Can this place also have bartenders who wear sleeveless (but brand new) band t-shirts, and "crazy hairstyles" that take an hour or more to do everyday?  Would it be possible for this place to plaster band and bumper stickers over every surface, so they LOOK like a live venue, even though band's don't typically play there?  Can I just belong because I've been a fashion victim through every other trend, and at least here I can ACT like I don't care, even though all I do is watch everyone sitting in this place, and hope they're watching me, too?

Finally, can this place (thankfully) have cheap drinks, and a (relatively) good jukebox that doesn't play so loud that you can't talk over it?

If you have answered "yes" to two or more of these questions, then Molotov's is the place for you.

As for me, the way I see it, rebellion is more than a t-shirt and a good record collection...and it's FAR more than just trying to fit in.
author: Kevin H.

description:
this is it....

some grit in the lower haight.........great happy hour specials...........doggie okie dokie.......good peeps to meet..........and we like the bartenderesses too......
author: alex m.

description: Nice selection of drinks and smiling bartenders, they have some pinball tables at the entrance and one pool table at the end. The place is not so huge, but it's in a great location if you're living around the Haight and need a beer halfway until you're reaching the next bar.
author: Tamas K.

description:
Bartenders will whore themselves out if you pay their rent. Literally. I'm not joking. Otherwise, good luck getting a watered down drink or piss warm beer. 'Regulars' = alcoholics from skid row.

Great place to get stabbed or a staph infection.
author: nic d.

description: Really cool dive bar to meet with a couple friends. Strong emphasis on dive bar.
author: Matt M.

description: Good neighborhood dive bar with cheap drinks, loud music, dark lighting and a zesty blend of locals. Great place if you don't want to be bothered when slammin' back shots or, conversely, if you want to chill with friends and shoot some pool.
author: Gina G.

description: I got the feeling that I didn't have enough tattoos to deserve the great honor and privilege of drinking in this little hole in the wall bar.  I probably wouldn't have even gone in if not for the two pinball machines sitting up front.  In hindsight I would have been better if I had just kept walking.  The beer was warm and the service was bad.  (Somehow when I brought back my empty pint glass and said "I'll have two more PBRs" I ended up with two bottles of PBR for the same price that two pints had cost me.)  I thought the pinball would save it, but the flippers kept getting stuck and one of the machines trapped a ball under one of the flippers, (no kidding - I tilted the machined and still couldn't get it out) thus ending my game and thankfully my time in Molotov.
author: dan d.

description: May my liver one day recover from a Molotov cocktail. Their paint peeling drinks, great jukebox, and awesome dive bariness will forever hold a special place in my heart. My out of town friends never fail to nearly drive themselves to alcohol poisoning thanks to stiff pours, great prices, and a great atmosphere. Highly recommended.
author: Allistair J.

description:
one time I came here and ordered a dirty martini, thinking "hey lucky 13s does it, why not these fucking punks" and not only was it shatty and served in a frou frou high-necked glass so i felt like a loser, it was fucking expensive, so i drank it and left

another time I came here and ordered fernet shots, there's two different kind of glasses you can use, big and small, and we got the small shot glasses, everyone else got the big ones

yet another time i came here and played the wrong song from the O Brother Where Art Thou soundtrack and got booed out of the place (seriously)

and then a while back i was in here wearing a carhartt jacket, and was told to take my wonderbread peckerwood ass back to humboldt (i am indeed white, well done hater, yet from the east coast) by a crackhead wielding a ballpeen hammer

this place does have its good points, if you own nothing but black jeans, use lengths of chain as both adornment and belts, have some more black demin goods covered in patches in the closet, and are convinced it's 1980 and you JUST BOUGHT black flag's 'damaged', and you give the stinkeye and stinkfist to anyone who's trying to politely tell you "punk is dead jackass, get with it"

other than that i don't see the point. i'll hang with the faux hippies over the faux punks anyway (at least i can get smoked out)

if you want the bullshit graffy ambience while you're boozin, go to 13s, they at least know how to make drinks

otherwise go to noc noc. fuck this place.
author: Chris R.

description: I got the metal vibe here, we ended up leaving after playin a nice game of pinball.
author: ella a.

description: I went to Molotov's for a birthday party yesterday...  I was a bit scared before entering but once I walked in it was welcoming. The beer is dirt cheep and the people are friendly.  I really enjoyed the strange bondage photos on the wall and the bar-dog.
author: Vespa Fox C.

description: Ick, ick, ick. My last bar fight was here, when it was the Midtown. It hasn't changed. Reminds me of a biker bar in my hometown I used to go to but without any of the charm or moderation.
author: patrick g.

description: After years of walking by, mainly because the crowd out front looked like it was going to gang rape me, I finally wandered in.  It's gritty and divey on the inside -- but, they do have a full bar, a pool table, and a decent juke box.
author: Tim G.

description: This place only gets one star because they have a pinball machine.  Otherwise it sucks and I'll never go there again.  The owner and the bartenders are rude.  They definitely use their right to refuse service to anyone.  I went there for a going away party and they kicked out 10 or so people because one member of our party didn't order a drink.  Total BS.  The only other saving grace for this place is that I think the juke box is cool.
author: Cyan C.

description: The largest and cheapest shot of Jameson that I have ever had. Bigger than Noc Noc and Toronado's, if you are in a larger group or want a seat.
author: Michael H.

description: I wish that I could give this place 'zero stars'.  That is how bad it is.  In fact besides 'Kate's Kitchen' and that one Sandwich place (I don't know the name) I think the lower haight is...... well, not for me.
author: Thadd L.

description: SUPER friendly bar staff (not). Guess you don't come here for the service, but the attitude was a little much. The jukebox playing rap threw me off for a little while until the punk rock finally came on towards the end...
author: Nicolas H.

description:
I give this place one star for the Pinball and for the surreal story I get to tell about my experience there.  My boyfriend and I went to check out the place, being big fans of the dive bar, and play some pinball.  I should have known when walking in that my pants weren't tight and black enough for this joint.  So after the 21 year old bartender stopped pretending to ignore us while acting important, we got some beers and played a few games of pinball.  We sat at the bar for a bit watching someone get killed in one of the Halloween movies playing above the bar.  When one of the pinball machines was free, we went over to play another game and put some money in the machine.
Here comes the good part... out of nowhere comes the Ozzy Osbourne wannabe with oh so tight pants and very carefully styled hair that was trying very hard to make a statement.  He got in my boyfriends face and informed him in the nicest of language that he was using the pinball machine.  I guess when he was outside having a cigarette he was "using" it.  Maybe he should have carved his name on the Lord of the Rings pinball machine with the switchblade I'm sure he had in his pocket.  Or maybe I should give the guy a break because he obviously just really loved his Frodo.
So I did something I've never done and got between this guy and my guy because I thought Ozzy may actually throw a punch over pinball and we're not exactly the types to get in a bar brawl.  For the first time in my life I felt like I might get hit (or stabbed) by a man.  So we walked away as young important feeling bartender stated repeatedly "He's a regular, I'd appreciate it if you'd leave."  Now... I understand the importance of respecting your regulars, but you might want to re-evaluate the ones who are picking fights over pinball.  It's a game, does it really make you that angry?  Or maybe the regulars are really all they have at the end of the day when they've scared everyone away.
author: Erin D.

description: After a particularly nasty breakup, my friend took me out  to Moltotov's on a Thursday night, where we sat drinking scotch at a dirty table. Hands down, there is no better place in all of San Francisco to drink your sorrows away. Pile on the hangover baby, pile it on.
author: Jeska D.

description: 3 stars for upgrading the stupid Pinball 2000 Revenge from Mars machine to Lord of the Rings.  If they'd only clean the inside of the playfield glass on the Creature From the Black Lagoon machine that's right next to it, and replace all of the burnt bulbs so you could see where the ball is, they'd have TWO great pinballs!!!  Cheap PBR is the 4th star.
author: Jake S.

description: So this is where the scum punk gliteratti hang out. Nasty, yucky, foul smelling, bad drink making, disgusting excuse for a bar. Sorry but this is not a typical SF dive bar. It's a terrible nightmare of a place. It's a strung out junkies wet dream, actually.  Same crap hole as when it was Midtown, ok, maybe worse. It got one star, because Yelp won't let me give it no stars
author: Ham and Eggs M.

description:
positives: good juke box. strong drinks, interesting people (sometimes, just their looks but whatever). bathroom isn't as gross as it could be.

negatives: some of the customers are nasty and they will hump your leg when you're too wasted to pay attention. 
live and learn.
author: Pam Z.

description: This is what a bar should be and what punk rock is, no fights, none needed. Sunday hardcore shows are the best replacement of a pool table ever.  The owner is awesome, if he sees you really enjoying yourself talking with friends don't be surprised to see him come over with a free round delivered to the table.  Name another bar where that could remotely happen!  The opposite of the clique across the street at Toronado, and Molotov's has the only liquor in the lower haight.
author: J D.

description: I'm standing outside, just led a group of 13 over to this bar that I've never seen.  We might not match the crowd, but we don't stand out. I hesitate, just for a second.  A guy with half a head of mohawk, another half head of braids says from behind me "don't be scared, just go in". He thought I was scared of the bouncer. Shit no. Bouncer looked friendly, I was just sizing up the scenario. Oh well. bottoms  up.
author: Anna O.

description:
snakes in a muthaf*kn bar!

really though. there was a weird dog in there playing frisbee with coasters (nobody knew who he was with) and some guy brought his snakes in for everyone to play with. A-Ma-Zing.

I got carded four times, had about 6 (yummy) drinks, and an overall swell time. Its my new neighborhood favorite.
author: Vanessa R.

description: If you use the internet to express your opinion on Molotov's, you don't belong there.
author: trevor c.

description: About what you can expect from a dive bar...good bartenders who mix some good drinks...a good juke box with awesome choices (Johnny Cash, Misfits, The Pogues) hell ya! Also, a full bar so I was able to fulfill my whiskey desires after being let down at the Mad Dog in the Fog...bonus star for having pinball machines (hell ya again!). Bonus star for having Newcastle on tap.  I would definitely come back here again (better that other bars in the area, for sure)
author: Matthew S.

description:
I wish I could take a star off for always feeling old whenever we walk in here, but that wouldn't be fair.  After all, anyone over the age of 30 might feel that way at Molotov's sometimes.

But I've always liked this place, not only because it occupies a very key and central location on lower Haight.  It has a great vibe, and I keep thinking that at some point the Ramones are going to burst out from the back and start playing.  In fact, this place *should* have live music, maybe something featuring local raw punk-rock talent a few nights a week.  I'm sure there's plenty of it.

Maybe it's due to the venue size that it does not.  If they had regular music much like Thee Parkside in Potrero Hill, this place would be damn near perfect.
author: Dave N.

description: Typical San Francisco dive bar and I usuallly like dive bars. Stickers on the walls, paintings on the doors, crappy little pool table and rude, snobby bartenders. Last time I was here, the jukebox was on repeat and the girl behind the bar yelled at us about our ID's and ignored me half the time I was looking for a drink. You're too cool for me? No, no I'm too cool for you because I won't be back here for a long time.
author: Michael E.

description:
OffenSe taken, cecelia b. This bar is my favorite. I'm not a hipster, and I have no idea who your "crazy fun" friends are...but who the f*ck wears beanies? Anyway, I've lived in the hood for over 10 years and this is by far my fav
bar. Always fun, GREAT jukebox, awesome bartenders...and if it's not your scene, here's a thought: maybe Molotov's just isn't your kinda place. And that's ok. It certainly doesn't justify a bad review. You holier than though person, you. Go to Danny Coyle's or Nickies. There's plenty non punk/hipster bars. Anyway, that said: this place is in danger of being sold very soon and turned into another lame bar with an internet jukebox. Sad. Please show your support.
author: Francis C.

description: good bar, usually has place to sit, nice staff
author: Michael E.

description: seriously, one of the best bars in the city. it's in my top 5.. cheap drinks, mixed crowd, awesome music and that pool table in the back... always plastered when i leave, and never a dull moment. oh, that metal storage unit by the pool table under the tv, best spot to sit for the whole night.. PBR please!
author: Manny M.

description: Yes.  I like it here.  Cute boys.  Pinball.  Good music.  Booths.  I've met two internet dates here.  Both went well.  I want to take home one of the grungy regulars.
author: Coco D.

description: Although the fragrance of this bar is sometimes a bit ripe, the drinks are cheap, and the juke box kicks. Service is so-so when they're busy, but it's a great meeting place for late afternoons on the weekend or week nights.
author: Crystal R.

description: Cheap drinks, but HOLY SMOKES...watch out for the psycho bar tender!  Typical lower haight watering hole.
author: Sarah D.

description: An enjoyable place. Dark and dirty...I'm glad I didn't have to pee.
author: Anita C.

description: Don't expect the bartenders here to greet you with a lollipop rainbow happy happy smile if they are not feeling it.  Sometimes they do sometimes they don't...but at least you get the sense there's no bullshit involved.  Just drink your fucking beer and start loving shit.  Good pinball machines, great jukebox, the surly attitude and short commute are all things i love about this place.  It's my local.
author: beltrand a.

description: Super chill atmosphere, great drinks, and loud music. This bar is fun and the crowd is interesting. Walking in I don't feel 'punk' enough, but am totally comfortable. I love it.
author: Ashley F.

description: Total dive, I seem to be the only person who didn't experience bad service here...the prices for drinks were good. Nothing else too noteworthy except it looked like the walls were partially covered in tin foil...and there is good pizza across the street....
author: Barbara A.

description: This place is really divey but has a kind of cool c'est la vie attitude to it. The patrons are diverse and friendly and it's a very chill atmosphere. Nice pool table, cheap drinks. I don't think I'll make this a regular place but it's not a place I would try to avoid or anything.
author: Cathy T.

description:
i've never had any problems at this bar, nor have i experienced/seen any fights go down...  i like this place.  the music is loud, the bar is a dive, people are chill.  i like the stickers all over the wall.  the bartenders seem cool to me...they always made sure i was okay w/my drink, and never did i receive a hint of attitude, but then again i don't come w/one either.  

it seems from the reviews that people aren't too keen on this place, or have not had good experiences.  the drinks are reasonable, and i like the joint because it's one of the places that have hard liquor in the lower haight.
author: Sheri N.

description:
the first time i walked into molotov's one of the regulars chugged a beer then slammed it on the table so hard that it completely shattered.  everyone laughed.

i have loved it ever since.


cleaniest bathroom at a dive bar ever.  cleaniest is cleaner than the cleanest, fyi.  for girls only, you have to get a key.  and it's great.  nice and roomie, very clean for a dive.

never had a problem getting a drink or two or five. (sailor jerry!) though i got a mighty weird look when i ordered a shitload of ouzo shots for me and co. to take on my birthday.  (OPA!)

i do have to say, this isn't the bar to go to if you want to mingle and get to know new people.  it's more a go there with your own entertainment/friends.  granted, i have never tried.  i am a tad on the shy side.

i always yo-yo myself between here and toronado (not a beer fan) which works out really well for my beer-loving posse of n3rds. and we always end the night playing a wicked awesome game (or 10) of erotic photohunt.   

and the characters that cruise by are always... well... characters.  one time, this homeless women tried to sell me a vhs of buffy the vampire slayer.  
VHS?  wtf is this? the 19th century?

point being:  good place.  i dig.
author: Ge O.

description: Molotov's is ok if you live nearby and don't feel like going far to have a drink out. That's exactly why we were here. The drinks were ok and cheap. I do think they were a little weak. The pool table is a bad idea. This is not the place to mingle, although I prefer it to the uppity hipsters down the street at Danny Coyle's.
author: Rachel B.

description: You'll know as soon as you set foot inside this bar whether it's for you.
author: Amy Z.

description: Eh, decent enough, pool table, so so jukebox... could do with out the gangsta rap but whatever works. Cheap drinks, stiff drinks.. enough to keep you coming back. Its cool if you can grab a table by the window. I try to avoid it on friday and saturday nights.. much better places to be off to. But this is a cool bar to grab a few drinks and a shot before heading out.
author: jamie z.

description: Holy shit mon! This joint is so freaking fake, filled with trust fund punk babies and drowning in sorrow.  If you like good vibes, then this is not your place.  If you dig masquerade and inspire to throw down in a moments notice, then here you be.  Only reason it gets two stars is the pinball and jukebox.  KEEP AWAY!
author: willy j.

description:
every time i go to san francisco, someone takes me to this bar. i think they characterize bars like this with me, because all i want to do is drink a beer, sit around with friends and talk, and probably talk a little shit while people watching.

cheap beer, service you'd expect based on environment, divey, no one cares what anyone else is doing or saying, and both times i've been lately have been to my benefit. 

next time i'm back, i'm sure i will drink here again.
author: Erin R.

description: This place was one of my favorites until they started playing scary top 40 music on the weekends.  Normally, this place is a slave to awesome rocker crap from the eighties and some punk mixed in.  I took a fellow out of town rocker to this place and went flush with embarrassment when the DJ whipped out a "Red Wine" remix, seriously.  Cool bar, but avoid on Saturday nights if this DJ thing continues....
author: Claire C.

description: I have a soft spot in my heart for this bar.  Maybe it's because Joel the bartender is so wonderful.  Maybe it's because my friend and I used to run down there between rounds of pub quiz at the Mad Dog to do shots (during the asinine "lo-carb" days - the MD only serves beer and wine) and I like places that give me good memories.  Whatever the reason, I make a rule to pop in there about quarterly.
author: darla s.

description:
this is my local, so i'm biased.


it's a great nostalgia bar...if you were born..like...40 years ago.


[review deleted]
i'm afraid of getting killed
author: Yasi S.

description: I'm not from SF but I visit often. Last year, after walking a few miles we stopped into Molotov's. Had a nice pint and pinball game. Great atmosphere and casual environment. Looking forward to having another drink and rest there this month!
author: Christina I.

description: For some reason I really do truly love this place.   I don't really blend in to well with the crowd considering that I do not own a black leather jacket, but I do wear black skinny jeans pretty often so next time i should remember to wear them.   But anyways.. I do have one thing in common with the staff and patrons, I do love the strong liquor drinks.  It is never too crowded and the bartenders are always generous with the amount of liquor in the cocktails.  When I want to have a mellow night, lower haight is always chill and Molotov's is like the only bar that serves liquor on the block so that makes it special as well as a treat.
author: Michelle N.

description: This is a watering hole for angsty bikers and people who feel pain. The drinks are aright, not the best but not the worst. I'd recommend sticking to beer here...save the cocktails and mixers for bars with more generous bartenders
author: Chloe D.

description: Stern, but Fair.  One point for booths another for the decent juke.  Oh yea and an invisible point for the name which i do indeed love.  Too many damn scenesters here though.  It gets confusing.  I just want a beer, not a scene.
author: Katie M.
