description: Typical dive bar, nice bartenders, pool table, a block from my house. Can't go wrong if you don't mind slayer playing nearly the whole time.
author: Marty K.

description: You know those places with dubious "Coldest beer in town!" signs? Well  $2 Pabst bottles here are like Foreigner playing "Cold as Ice" during the half time show at the '67 NFC championship...  Seriously though, its cold.
author: Codester H.

description: A punk rock dive bar that plays hard-core hip hop--my kinda place! The bartenders haircuts look like the place feels, and they mix a mean drink. This is the birthplace of my infamous drink: the Bull Screwed Red (Redbull, OJ, vodka, with a splash of cranberry juice).
author: K. C.

description:
molotov's is the epitome of what bars in the lower haight are..kind of  divie, but you can still get a good beer/drink at a good price, play pool or pinball and have great conversations with people doing the same...great selection of draft beer too!

this place rocks! 

i heart molotov's!

honestly, i have had one bad experience here, and it wasn't with a regular (i asked the bartendress),  it was probably that douchebag trevor D...
author: shannon s.

description: I went to this place for the first time this past saturday. The place was hipster central (lower haight, should i have expected anything else?) They had pretty cheap drinks and the bartenders were quick to. The highlight was the people watching topped off by two tattooed hipster chicks getting into an argument about some dude. All in all i would go back for the cheap drinks and hipster watching.
author: mike m.

description: Ah, my home-away-from-home when I lived in SF.  Cheap booze, great music, cool servers, and fun people to talk to.  I've been here on New Year's Eve, Tuesday-happy-hours, Fruday-night-just-before-closing, Sunday-hair-of-the-dog-brunch.  It's all great.  Geez, I miss SF sometimes!
author: Tricia Y.

description: I think from the outside this place looks pretty intimidating because it's so dark outside.  I also thought it might be an evil anarchist society due to it's name and their cocktails, but in actuality this place is cool and layed back.  I'd go back without a doubt.
author: Jonathan T.

description: This place was hella funny. Me and two friends went there after lunch @ Memphis Minnie's. The bartender was cool, she shared a bottle of Sessions with us cus she overheard us talking about how we never had it. The funny part about this place was that there was mostly hippy/grunge/punk dudes there, however they were all bobbing their heads to old rap music like NWA and Run DMC. If I wasn't driving that day we would have stayed there for many more bevies.
author: Jose E.

description:
if i could live here, i would.

oh wait. i pretty much do.

pinball, great beers on tap, a jukebox that mimics my cd collection, pool table, surly bartenders, great vibe.

yep. we likes it.
author: Gary V.

description: This place has a great jukebox, cheap drinks, a pool table, and TVs for ball games. It's got everything you want at a bar really and it's one of the first places I'll go check out at a random night in San Francisco. Obviously parking sucks around here but then again it's FRISCO....
author: Taeil K.

description: Down in dirty in a good way, cheap strong drinks, sometimes a little to crusty for my taste.
author: brian m.

description: If I go out drinking, I always end up here.  No matter where I start.  The drinks are strong and not too pricey.  The music is perfect.  Two of my good friends recently slow danced to Metallica in the middle of the bar and it may have been one of the greater moments of my life.  I always run into interesting people here and I love that there are usually puppies hanging out. Good times, I say.
author: Jessica T.

description:
kick ass bar, decent day time drink specials. great punk classics on the juke box. 

having a drink here will give you confidence and energy for where ever your heading next. I love this bar.
author: Brandi S.

description: I like Molotovs. I used to come drink here often before I moved to the city. It reminds me a lot of dives from back home in Southern Cali. The bartenders are never nice, but what's new. It's SF. There's always an interesting mix of characters in here and if you're on a bad date, at least you can people watch and shit talk. And p.s. I love DOG FRIENDLY BARS!!
author: citygirls f.

description:
loud, dirty, obnoxious, open air, place to lose a few bucks @ pool. convenient to rosamunde & memphis minnie's.

what's not to like? if you like dive bars - you'll like molotovs. & I do.
author: Lawrence K.

description: Down and dirty in the lower haight.  This bar represents everything that is great about the lower haight.  punk as fuck and they know it.  dirty as hell and they don't give a shit.  cheap as a tai hooker and perfect for us scumbag types that can not afford the shee shee shit that has been popping us every where else in this great down and dirty neighborhood.  what the fuck is with the yuppiefied places taking the place of the shit holes that the neighborhood is known for.  Molotovs keeps it real for the people.  god bless, or so says uncle al
author: Uncle AL J.

description: I like my dives and this is one of 'em. It's of the punky neighborhood sort and the barkeeps are surprisingly nice. The pool table is a plus and if you've had a bad day there's always some old, random movie on mute, with closed captioning playing on the small tv up in the corner. Stare at it and drown your sorrows in PBR, Jack Daniels and Rancid.
author: Marty S.

description: i'd go back. cool space. bad use of it. the pool table is in a tight spot ....and you need a key for the ladies room. that bothers me
author: kiki b.

description: I went here once. The bar was full of wanna-bees. Snobby rock fakes.
author: Trevor D.

description: I would give it one and a half for effort, if that. I mean it's a bar with some pretty stupid people in it. Well, you can get completely wasted on beers and booze here (not many bars in this neighborhood have booze and beers), but it won't be cheap. Probably cheaper to go next door and get some and go home. Maybe it's even more fun to do that. I hate the TVs in here, so distracting, but sometimes they put on a good horror movie to distract you from the shitty conversations. I think this bar is more tolerable if you're drunk already that way you can get into a gnarly ass fight afterwards as you get kicked out and 86'd from the place. Then you wouldn't have to go back and maybe go to a better bar with better patrons who can actually hold a decent conversation with you. The jukebox has good music though, there's at least one star for that. Oh the pool table...which is always being hogged by some drunk asshole. Well, if that's your game go for it, otherwise go somewhere else I suppose.
author: Gina R.

description: i have always had fun here. the crowd is a mix of the young pseudo-punk kids and the older crustier generation of real punks.also crackheads and shit-faced drunks. but that really only adds to the charm in my opinion.  the music is always amazing. and somehow there is always a dog (pit pull) in the bar. pretty fun spot. cheap drinks, great music, awesome people watching... what more do you need?
author: Ashley A.

description:
This place is the 'local' for one of my best friends, so I was stoked to check it out a few weekends ago.  That said, as an old(er) school punk (middle school to high school in the mid to late 80's/early 90's), this place leaves me with mixed feelings.  I was really stoked on a few things:

1. Joy Division on the jukebox
2.  Dirty ass toilet
3. A few 'core' folks that gave off attitude because they truly don't give a fuck
4. Cheap drinks

I was also pissed off about a few other things:

1. There were quite a few youngsters that probably don't know who the fuck Joy Division is/was, and if they do, they have no idea that JD didn't look "punk" because they created punk and didn't need to look like anything.....as in, it's an attitude, not a look......EMO fools.
2. Some of the people that gave off a little attitude were sucking their mother's nips when I was listening to the likes of "Never Mind the Bollocks, Here's the Sex Pistols", "S&M Airlines" and other great albums.  Look, I have no problem with punk kids (I'm not claiming to be an OG punk), but have some fucking respect.....and if you have a weener, wear male jeans for fucks sake.
3. Mr. bartender....yeah you, with the female size 4 jeans, fucked up haircut and intentionally shitty tattoos (at least for your sake I hope those are intentionally shitty), SHOW SOME RESPECT.  There's a difference between a punk rock attitude (ie. no respect for authority) and being an ass to someone that has the size and know-how to tie your skinny ass into a pretzel.  You should go for the former.

Overall, I dig this place, though.  It would just be nice if the kids earned their stripes before becoming old and bitter like me.
author: Travis F.

description: came here last night on X-Mas for cheap drinks and it was packed, dog friendly, skinny jeans, bad haircuts and beanies crowd.
author: Pickle R.

description: standard punk rock bar, but clean and not smelly. the bartenders are really nice and they definitely gain points for having a resident dog, Sancho.
author: frankie c.

description: I was drinking at Toronado across the street and because I know nothing of rare specialty beers I chose my beer because the name sounded cool and it was not. I decided also after that first beer I was in a faster kind of mood that required cocktails so Molotov's called out to me. My friends and I rolled in rather late so the crowd had died a little and we were treated to the publicly drunkess two people I've ever seen try to get into the bar.  The bouncer who I will refer to as Punk Rock handled himself well and talked down the swaying belligerants outside. After finishing a couple of drinks I went out for a smoke and saw the same drunk dudes play Hey Mister to the liquor store next door as the store owner wouldn't let them in in their condition. Then I watched as one of them repeatedly failed at opening his Corona with a Bic lighter. Watching both drunks was akin to watching a national geographic animal show. The way they had found their sustenance but could not figure out how to get to it. Another observer finally hailed a cab and poured both the drunks in and ended my entertainment.  I had a good time at Molotov's. The place was dark but not un-navigateable and they made my drinks strong. The prices were cheap and the people seemed alright. Yay Cocktails.
author: Don L.

description: Molotov's is a great, chill dive bar which tends to attract cool, down-to-earth crowds. The jukebox is one of the best I have heard in any dive in the city, usually void of any current "top 40" shit, but yet still diverse and surprising (going from playing Discharge to Hank Williams Sr. to old-school gangsta rap in a span of ten minutes).  The bartenders are all cool folks who will chat with you if you sit at the bar counter, and they usually have a good movie playing on the tv. It's a tad dark inside, which is a plus for those who often go on dive bar expeditions alone. The drink prices are pretty good, and there is a special on bottled PBR all day ($2). The location on Lower Haight can't be beat - there's a taqueria, a pizza place, and a deli across the street to satisfy those late-night drunk munchies, and usually no drugged-up asshole squatters to harass you for money outside the bar - they usually remain on upper Haight from Cole St. on over. Highly reccomended.
author: Sean R.

description: Cool neighborhood bar.....went on a monday night and the crowd was friendly and pretty mellow.  Played it up on the pool table and enjoyed a PBR.  Would drop back in if I was in the neighborhood.
author: Allison M.

description: i love this bar!  yea, it stinks like vomit most days, except the days it stinks like ammonia.  just what a dive bar should be!  drinks are strong and cheap, and they open at a reasonable hour (before noon) - what more do you want?  oh, and when the sun's out, you can sit hanging out the front window, so it's kind of like a patio.
author: eeeee d.

description: walked in saturday night after having been at mad dog in the fog. my wife and i found md in the fog thoroughly dull, unless you are a soccer fan. i said lets try this shit hole. wearing my nra silver belt buckle, $300 ostrich skin cowboy boots and tweed sports coat, i didn't exactly fit in. however i had no problem getting served by the barely 21 year old bartender. i have been a clash city rocker since i saw them with the who in 1982. there were a few other patrons that might have been alive then sitting around. i thought that the music was okay, clash, roiling stones and i think i heard the kinks too. i am not too sure about the kinks, i had a few and we had been to several bars already. even so i liked the music although it was a little loud for the wife, at least they had some college football on the tube, i think, might have been another bar. i like to consume alcohol. finished our drinks and said adios. it would be a better place for me and my cousins bf to drink. he is 16 years younger and would really love this place.
author: scott c.
